Reviews.Title: “Great Service the Best Staff”
Reviews.Author: Mike H
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Comfort Suites on several occasions and experience consistent quality service. The location is just awesome and the service is better. I ran into an a.c. challenge in one room, called the desk, the service person arrived within 2 minutes and I was immediately transferred to another room, an upgraded room, instead of being left to sweat it out. What more can you ask for? The employees actually know your name, not just at the front desk but 4-5 employees throughout your visit will surprise you. Very convenient to all transportation. The rates are very reasonable for this area. You will have a refrigerator and laundry facility right in your room. Beautiful view while running along the lake at sunrise.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location and Value in Downtown”
Reviews.Author: J-P N
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I came to Chicago for a trip last August and chose this hotel based on the reviews we read here. We arrived at Midway airport and easily navigated the subway system to find the hotel. (its a few minutes walk from all lines servicing the entire city!). We quickly realized that we picked the right hotel. Everything we wanted to do was either walkable (Magnificient mile, Navy Pier, Millenium Park, Bicycle Tour etc...) or easy to navigate on the subway or bus. We had no problems with the hotel services either. They had a great continental breakfast every morning. Many other hotels in the area had a similar or slightly higher rate but did not offer the breakfast, so this was a bonus! Also, the hotel was recently renovated, so everything was pretty new. The room and view was great for the price. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay at the Comfort Suites on North Michigan”
Reviews.Author: RoseD D
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel approx. 6 months ago and then returned to it this past week. Since my last visit the rooms have been updated. The updating is awesome! For the business person: There are 4 outlets at the desk! Internet access has 4+ bars. And if you're staying a long time in that location, each room has a washer and dryer and a full--really full-kitchen. For the casual traveler, the views from the rooms are spectacular. There are only 4-5 rooms on each floor. So, it's more like a boutique hotel. There are two TVs--one in the living room area and one in the bed room. It's nearby EVERYTHING! Marilyn Monroe is about 2 blocks away! Good restaurants within 1-2 blocks, train to O'Hare about 4 blocks away. And of course, you're just 2 blocks from State street shopping! Great bedding! The folks working there are very friendly. The breakfast is a full breakfast with eggs, meat, waffles, cereal and fruit. Good juice selection. It was the best hotel I've stayed at for some time!

Reviews.Title: “Staff, room, price, and location were amazing!”
Reviews.Author: we6374
Reviews.Content: The staff was beyond helpful with with directions, suggestions, and "how to's." The room was amazing and location was perfect. This will be the only hotel we stay in while in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A weekend get-away suprise”
Reviews.Author: FLHTCI
Reviews.Content: I booked this through an online site based on the price and Tripadvisor reviews. We laughed as we got off the elevator into a very small hallway. We were pleasantly suprised when we entered the room. We had a suite that included refrigerator, range, dishwasher, washer/dryer but most of all the amount of room. It was not your typical city room where you could barely turn around. This had pleanty of room for the sofa sleeper to stretch out. We could also look down onto Michigan Ave. There was an internet connection in the room but since we did not have computers we used the ones in the business center. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: r t
Reviews.Content: When i booked the hotel , i was having doubt regarding the location,etc. The hotel though located in a bit isolated area has all the facilities for a comfortable stay. The shuttle service provided to the airport and the metro is very useful and convenient. The rooms are reasonably good with necessary facilities.

Reviews.Title: “3 Month Wedding Anniversary/Pre Valentine's Day”
Reviews.Author: Sharon D
Reviews.Content: My huband and I had a wonderful stay. All the hotel employees that we came in contact with were excellent. I made my reservation through Patrick Kennedy, Director of Sales. Through many phone calls and emails between us, he made sure the stay was equal to the five star facilities that you would expect. He was very kind, attentive and went out of his way with an upgraded room and some unexpected surprises in our room (which I wish to keep a secret)! We had a view of Michigan Avenue.I wanted to light the fireplace another added surprise) but we werent quite sure on how to get it started. I do a lot of homework on Oyster and Trip Advisor for their reviews and this is was a great hotel. Thanks so much Patrick and staff for making it a wonderful experience. We will stay again on our 1 year anniversary in January and hopefully in between just for a getaway! Thanks, Sharon & Richard

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable accommodations in the Windy City”
Reviews.Author: rywwong
Reviews.Content: Comfortable self-contained apartments with kitchenette in downtown Chicago. Not the best views but on the high floors the feeling is good nonetheless. Elevators can be a tad noisy but otherwise the bed is comfortable and apartment is clean. Included breakfast buffet is generous and has variety for most tastes. Convenient to the Red-line and the loop and convneience stores in the same block. Great steaks and seafood like Moreton's, Smith and Wollensky, and McCormick and Schmick's all within walking distance. Wired and wireless internet is free but dreadfully slow when handling large files. Would come back for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Great value!”
Reviews.Author: JosieMcA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is In a great location and an excellent value. Very clean and perfect for longer stays with stocked kitchenette and laundry right in the bedroom. Unfortunately I was only there for one night, so I couldn't take advantage of the amenities. Quiet room and very comfortable bed. Bathroom was a tad small but really there was nothing bad about this place. It was within walking distance of lots of places to see. Wish I could have stayed longer. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Treat!”
Reviews.Author: Diane296
Reviews.Content: My second visit proved more satisfying than the first. As a choice privileges member, room upgrade with a Marilyn view and early check-in put a big smile on my face. Front desk staff, especially Eileen, were professional, friendly, and helpful. Rooms with sitting areas and kitchenettes make it easy to feel at home but be away...and not make the bed. Keep in mind that the discount tix booth and Trader Joe's are only a few blocks from the Comfort Suites. Great location....give it a try!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great location & great value!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kdonze
Reviews.Content: Very, very happy with our stay here! Paid $72 for a Saturday night and $37 for valet parking. Overall a great value for Michigan Ave. Room was clean and comfortable. We were in room 1205 which was a corner city view room. Had a full kitchenette and W/D. Living area very spacious. Bed was queen with pillowtop, very comfortable. Flat screen tv in both living room and bedroom. Front desk staff was very friendly. Standard continental breakfast. Will definitely return when visiting Chicago again. Highly recommend this place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Expectations were high; results were even better”
Reviews.Author: StatServe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here Thursday and Friday evening, January 19th and 20th, mainly due to the extermely kind reviews on this site. I was very doubtful that the hotel could provide the level of service and accomodations listed for the incredibly low price. Even if this hotel were not located in downtown Chicago, the price was almost too good to be true. The only down side, as mentioned elsewhere, is that valet parking for two nights cost almost as much as one night stay in the room. Since I had read that in the reviews it did not come as a surprise. Check-in was very smooth, efficient, friendly and quick. Now to the best part! The room was incredible. Spacious, would be an understatement. With windows overlooking Michigan Avenue and the Chicago River it was nice to look out at the snow storm outside while remaining so comfortable inside. I don't want to be repetetive with what the rooms have to offer other than to say that my scepticism was quickly put to rest. Many apartments have fewer amenities. Washer, dryer, stove/oven, microwave, flat screen TVs (2), separate bedroom,breakfast bar, full table setting for two. Seldom does an establishment live up to its billing, but this one does. We did manage to make it to a couple of the incredible pizza places that Chicago is justifiably famous for. In the snow on Friday evening we trudged to the Giordano's just a little over a block south of the hotel. The next time I go to Chicago I won't waste any time searching out accomodations; I will plan on going back to the Comfort Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the Rough!”
Reviews.Author: MillieD1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of downtown Chicago and on magnificient mile and perfect for business or pleasure travellers. Rates are three star but the professionalism and courtesy of the staff is 5 star. The rooms themselves boast a mini kitchenette and personal laundromat - excellent for the long week travellers like us. Complimentary breakfast was continental and offered healthy options.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: lfia23
Reviews.Content: While the lobby is tiny, our room (14th floor) was huge - 2 queens, kitchenette, nice bathroom - and very clean. Location, just off Wacker and the Chicago River, puts you within close walking distance to the Miracle Mile, the Loop, and the Art Institute of Chicago/Millenium Park. The breakfast was okay -- not memorable, but decent. And the value, for downtown Chicago - fantastic.We paid $87/night. I liked that they don't nickle and dime you (free wireless internet -- Chicago Marriott, are you listening?) and an option to self-park across the street for $32/day. Trust me, this is a good rate for Chicago. A valet parking option is also available. Service is also excellent. A slow draining tub was dealt with immediately; good advice on dining in the Loop area. It doesn't have the ambience of a boutique hotel, but is a great option for a value-conscious traveller who still wants a good location and quality room.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping and maintenance becoming iffy”
Reviews.Author: EFFor
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel. The location on Michigan Avenue is excellent, close to Millennium Park, shopping, restaurants, the Art Institute, and a reasonable walk to Navy Pier,the Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium, Adler Planetarium, etc. The front desk people were welcoming and friendly. As is typical for Comfort Inns, the bed was very comfortable. (When staying at chain hotels, I prefer this chain for their comfortable beds.) Alas, I found the facility becoming just a bit seedy. In my first room on this stay, several slats were missing from the blinds. Although maintenance promptly replaced some, the mechanism holding one of the slats was broken so that slat could not be replaced. Also, the blinds in one of the windows didn't properly close. The hotel changed my room. In the second room, the stove burners, apparently replacements, did not fit properly. The top of the toilet tank had cracked at some time in the past. Although the repair was sound enough from a functional standpoint, it was sloppily done. (Why not just replace the tank top?) The quick cleaning administered daily by the housekeeping staff did not always include vacuuming. Also, on my second morning I left a few dishes in the dishwasher, intending to run the dishwasher after more had accumulated. Returning while my room was being cleaned, I was horrified when I saw the maid unloading the dirty dishes from the dishwasher, rinsing the dishes by hand in the sink with only tap water - no soap - then returning the dishes to the cabinets. I ate breakfast at the hotel on my first morning. The eggs resembled rubbery yellow discs. After that, I passed on the hotel breakfast. Would I recommend this hotel? I'm not sure. The price is reasonable for the excellent location. Increased management attention to maintenance and housekeeping details would be welcome.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Middle of the corn field, Illinois
Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: dustyzz75
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a comedy show. The location was great (close to the Chicago Theater) and the room was incredibly large, especially for the price ($82!). Very nice to have a kitchen (not to mention a refridgerator) and separate bedroom. Also, the breakfast was good with eggs (hard boiled and scrambled patties), sausage, waffles, and assorted breads and fruit. The only drawback, the bathroom was rather utilitarian. Not bad, just reminded me of my college apartment. Oh! Almost forgot, the room has a washer and dryer! I've stayed in several suites and weekly stay hotels, I've never had laundry in the room. Outstanding perk if you're staying several nights/week.

Reviews.Title: “amazing experience at comfort suites chicago”
Reviews.Author: chalouisduletz
Reviews.Content: Booked a queen suite for $100 a night after reading reviews here. At check-in was informed we'd been upgraded to a king suite It was especially nice as a male couple not to receive any of the usual "do you need separate beds?" nonsense. Room 2505 if you can get it: it's enormous, I'd guess 800 s.f. The view from the huge bedroom window and the private terrace goes right up Michigan Avenue to the river, Mag Mile, Wrigley building and Trump tower. Full kitchen with two grocery stores within a couple of blocks -- just ask the desk, they couldn't have been more helpful. Washer and dryer in the room so you can travel light. Free Internet (luxury hotels, are you listening? FREE Internet.) Breakfast with eggs, meat, fruit, juices, coffee included. What's not to love? First floor lay-out is a rabbit warren, and the elevators are a tad pokey, but honestly, this could be the best deal in the Windy City. Look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - don't bother looking elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: Scooterpooch
Reviews.Content: This place is perfect - easy walking distance and close to everything you would want to see in Chicago. We stayed here for 4 nights in mid December, and the hot breakfast is included which was very welcome, especially for the very reasonable price. Rooms are comfy and spacious and well appointed. The washer and dryer in the room was a bonus too. Staff are great - courteous and genuinely helpful and friendly. Any questions or requests are answered and accommodated speedily and with a smile. A special thanks to conciege David! Definitely recommend this place and will stay here next time we're in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Mandygrace
Reviews.Content: This place was great. The staff was very welcoming and accommadating. We were upgraded to the presidental suite upon arrival, which was fantastic in itself. At checkout, it was an easy process and they held our bags for serveral hours while we toured Chicago. They were most helpful when my sister forgot an important piece of paper in the room. They stopped cleaning and allowed us the opportunity to search through the room. I highly recommend this hotel for your upcoming stay in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Why Am I Back Home????:)”
Reviews.Author: Ashley R
Reviews.Content: This review is way overdue but here we go:) I visited Chicago for the first time December 20th-29th for my 7th year anniversary. After booking flights and looking for my perfect hotel...i came across Comfort Suites on Michigan Avenue. I have to give myself a pat on the back because i could not have made a better decision. This hotel is hands down one of the best hotels i have ever visited. And I'm hungry for more LOL:) Arrival/Room: When we arrived, we were greeted by the famous and fabulous staff members of Comfort Suites. With all smiles, they wished us a happy anniversary ( without us mentioning it ) and wished us a happy stay with them. We took the elevators up to the 24th floor and our mouths dropped when we opened the door to our suite. We had been upgraded to the EXECUTIVE KING SUITE!!!!! This room had a FULL KITCHEN, FULL LIVING AREA, CLOSET AFTER CLOSET, WASHER N DRYER, CEILING TO FLOOR VIEWS, 2 TVS, DINING ROOM TABLE AND SAVING THE BEST FOR LAST.........A FULL BALCONY!!!!!! I swear i felt myself tearing LOL but honestly its was simply beautiful. Patrick Kennedy ( Director of Sales ) had a bottle of bubbly and little goodies set up for us and i knew this was going to be the best vacation ever. How kind was that huh? Breakfast: Unfortunately we only took part of this for one morning. The hubby and i are LATE sleepers and the time change/ weather didn't help:). But for the one day they had the freshest waffles, sausage, yogurt, fruit, juices, muffins and bagels. It was delicious and a great way to start your day in the Windy City. Parking/ Location: We also didn't take part of this because we flew and did NOT rent a vehicle, which brings me to my next topic....LOCATION. You do NOT need a vehicle because this hotel is literally right smack in the middle of EVERYTHING. I hate driving, so i was so thrilled waking up everyday knowing that my destination for the day ( I.E. Navy PIer or Water Tower Place ) was only a few steps or blocks away. Like most Americans, we partake in fast food. There was Chipotle, Subway, Qdoba and yummy Sushi restaurants literally connected to Comfort Suites. Another great comment was that there was a Walgreens, CVS and 7 Eleven all within steps of Comfort Suites. We used these stores for little snacks and other little things that you could forget to pack while traveling. So traveling families ( with young children ) don't worry.The location of this hotel is unbelievable you can NOT find one better. You will see when you get there:) Staff: Speechless. Ashley was so cheerful and always ready to help Rachel was very sweet and went above and beyond to print out a list restaurants that were open on Christmas Day for me and the hubby. Housekeeping were so nice and didn't mind coming a little later in the day for us because as i said we are NOT early morning people. They were great. 2 graveyard shift guys.....i forgot their names but they were always smiling even during the wee hours of the morning. Patrick Kennedy thank you soooooo much for making this anniversary the best!!!! Your beautiful building, lovely staff and amazing hospitality will always be remembered by us. We will be returning to Chicago very soon and without second thought...be staying with you guys again. Happy New Year to all:)

Reviews.Title: “Again....The Best Stay Ever in a Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Eugene_033
Reviews.Content: In June 2011 we stayed here for 3 nights and we not only loved Chicago but also this hotel! We got the idea to visit Chicago again during the Christmas Holidays in Week 52. After emailing with the Hotel's GM Natalie, we decided to book! We arrived on the 24th of December and check in when lightning fast....because i'm a valued member of Choice Hotels, we received a complimentary upgrade. So we where very curious. Last time we stayed on the 23rd floor with City View and this room was already great. But they surprised us again...we got the suite on 2505 with even more spectacular views.....your bedroom had a view on downtown Chicago!! It was really amazing!!! One small point of attention. Breakfast starts and ends to soon. During holidays there are practically no Business guests so why start at 06:00 - 09:00? I would start at 06:30 - 09:30, after all it's a holiday and people tend to stay somewhat longer in bed :-) Again also the service was super, all the staff members from Housekeeping to Reception...you all receive 5 Stars!!!! And again, a special thanks to Natalie. Unfortunately we did not meet in real life....but this will for sure not be our last visit to Chicago!! Thanks again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Best of Many Hotel Stays”
Reviews.Author: action_jackson2
Reviews.Content: Our stay at The Comfort Suites was amazing. One of the best non-resort hotels I have experienced. Our room was wonderful, with a kitchen, washer & dryer and a beautiful view of Michigan Ave. The staff was ever-friendly, offering suggestions on where to eat and how to catch the tour bus (also a great experience). Being a foodie, I can enthusiastically praise the breakfast included in the price of the hotel. Should I visit Chicago again, I would not hesitate to stay at Comfort Suites again :).

Reviews.Title: “Great view and a great value”
Reviews.Author: Ro_Fr87
Reviews.Content: I had a fantastic experience when I stayed here. All of the staff were extremely pleasant, Including Rachael at the front desk. Everyone was very helpful and the room was great! Perfect for a little getaway in the city! I had to leave early in the morning, and I was still able to enjoy the complimentary breakfast. The breakfast starts at 6 am and had a variety of options to choose from. My friend and I will definitely be back to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Always wonderful”
Reviews.Author: bwhitney24
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to this hotel for a few days in between Christmas and New Years for many years. Not only do we as a family enjoy it but also our friends who join us. Our group loves the island and kitchen space for entertaining and cards. The location is wonderful and the staff is great as well. Large rooms with refrigerators and laundry make this a great place with kids to deal with left-overs and messes on clothes. Will be back next Holiday season!

Reviews.Title: “Location, room size, service and value are all outstanding”
Reviews.Author: mptopham
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a fantastic location, right in the heart of downtown walking distance to all attractions and the best restaurants and bars. Despite being on the busy Michigan Avenue the room was very quiet and being at the front had a great view. The room was unbelievably big for a city centre hotel with a good size bathroom, a bedroom, and a large lounge with kitchenette sofa and desk. They also all have washer/dryers which is a great touch. The staff are all very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is included and is quite passable. The bes thing about this hotel though is the price you get all this for, it is an absolute bargain.

Reviews.Title: “In the Heart of Downtown!”
Reviews.Author: Tydewi
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Comfort Suites downtown Chicago for one night in room 1105. The hotel staff was very pleasant, especially during this busy holiday season. We could not have asked for more. The room was very clean. The kitchen area was spotless. We had a single queen room and it was the largest room of our group, we had five rooms total, and the evening party was in our room because of the large living area and the wonderful views of the river and Michigan avenue. The breakfast was the usual fare, but was hot and free! Thanks to the staff at the Comfort Suites for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in the city center!”
Reviews.Author: Peter v
Reviews.Content: We had a perfect time in Chicago not the least due to the large spacious appartment we had. The nice shopping area is very close to the hotel. Also the Sears tower etc is close by.

Reviews.Title: “What a great combination of...everything.”
Reviews.Author: Kelly M
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at this hotel and it keeps getting better. Love the city views, plentiful space, and prime location. I can't think of a better spot to stay in the city. The hallway of our last room (corner space) was longer than every apartment I've lived in - pack your bowling balls and pins. In the past year, they've added wifi internet coverage all the way to the top of the building, the only thing that was missing our first time through. Fantastic value for the location, which I wouldn't change if I could. Quick jaunts to trains, parks, shopping, and restaurants - nothing is lacking in any of those departments. Only one thing could have improved this last stay - more days to our trip. Maybe next time...

Reviews.Title: “Grate location-Grete service”
Reviews.Author: BCEUROPA
Reviews.Content: We were a school group (42 persons) , The Comfort Suites Hotel is right on Michigan Avenue (the Miracle Mile of shopping!). the rooms are big and with a good view of the river , the staff is nice. The breakfast grate. Patrick Kennedy the Director of sales was very helpful with the reservations , Thanks ti all !!! Cris

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LovetheBeach64
Reviews.Content: My 16 year old daughter and I were guests at the Comfort Suites the night of Dec 10, 2011. The hotel is fantastic: Great location, friendly/accomodating staff, spacious rooms with a full kitchen and very comfortable beds. We shopped State Street, Michigan Avenue/Watertower Place, dined at Signature on 95th, Grand Lux Cafe and enjoyed the sights at Navy Pier and Millenium Park -- all within walking distance of Comfort Suites. We had a great time and will definitely consider staying at Comfort Suites for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Xmas shopping trip”
Reviews.Author: debbieg22
Reviews.Content: Just returned from chicago for our annual Xmas shopping trip,stayed at the Comfort suites for 6 nights in a king suite with my sister and 2 daughters, Room was brilliant with a good view of the river and Michigan Ave had plenty of room for us all (room 2304), room had a full kitchen and a washer and dryer I have never been to chicago and returned with a suitcase full of clean clothes!! which was a bonus, Staff on reception were excellent nothing was too much trouble printing off rail timetables and directions and extra blankets etc, even when we couldnt get the bathroom door to open the reception sent the maintainance man to our room within 5 minutes, I have stayed in many hotels in chicago city centre and this one rates with the best of them. The hotel is in a great location to visit all the sites. Trying to talk the husband in taking me back in the summer!!

Reviews.Title: “Quick trip to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Barbara N
Reviews.Content: The Comfort Suites Hotel is right on Michigan Avenue (the Miracle Mile of shopping!). The hotel is small and a bit dated; however, the rooms are spotless, the staff is nice. My suite had a petite but full kitchen, including dishwasher. There was even a clothes washer and dryer in the suite. The hotel serves a full breakfast. It was a great place to stay and relax after meetings and shopping! The housekeeper, Marcia, said to mention her - great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great views, spacious room”
Reviews.Author: nyc2sfo
Reviews.Content: Though I only stayed here two nights, this hotel made a huge impression on me. The location alone made it worth it. All the other pluses-- the views, the space, the in-room laundry and full kitchen-- were just added bonuses. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: Shannon876
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay. The view from our room was breathtaking, and the staff gave us great service. Steve at the front desk went out of his way to give us great service and helped us choose a fabulous restaurant for dinner. Thanks, Steve & Comfort Suites, for a great weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: TerriBea
Reviews.Content: We can't say enough about the Comfort Suites. From the moment we got there, the service was excellent. Everyone was helpful and informative. Our room was beautiful ~ we had several views of the river, plus a complete kitchen and living area - including a washer and dryer. The bathroom is small, but it was so clean, the floor shined. When we were ready to leave, one of the guest ambassadors, David Kavaliunas, helped us load our packages and take them to our car. He was extremely helpful and concerned that we had a nice visit wth them. And we did. We would highly recommend Comfort Suites to anyone who wants a relaxing, enjoyable visit to Chicago and wishes to stay along Michigan Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Three star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Shirinak
Reviews.Content: 1:The phone in living area not working( not fixed during my stay).2:sink in bathroom not drainig water, 3:electrical plug not working in kitchen and finally 4:It was raining and when i reached the hotel in the evening second day of my stay i saw water was dripping from ceiling. I called reception ( David who was very nice and helpful during my stay) he transfer me to night shift head ( Gaven) and he said there is no maintanence at night and he can not do anything rxcept move me to 4th or 6th floor. I refused to move due to increase noice from street. In the morning i went down and inform reception (Eileen) and she promised to either solve the problem or move me to another room in high floors. Around four o'clock I went back to the hotel and she told me that all problems were solved. Telephone still not working. Plug still not working. Sink Drain was fine and finally water was not dripping any more but ceiling was still wet ( no more rain during my stay to check if it was really fixed). Other negative points: No enough space in restaurant to seat specially in the peak time for breakfast. Lobby very small and ugly. No door between bedroom and kitchen. Room service was not proper:not cleaning the floor whole my suay(6days) and they did not put shampoo and tissue box in the bathroom for 3 consecutive days. I called David for shampoo the third day at night and he sent for me one.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a strong consideration”
Reviews.Author: BayareaCooler
Reviews.Content: Switched over to this hotel at the last moment. I had two other hotels (comfort inn & suites downtown; Holiday Inn - Mart plaza) in the list; the first one for comfort (breakfast, close to MMile etc); Holiday Inn obviously has better views but no breakfast, no microwave & refrigerator. Comfort suites satisfied all my requirements (family style, on Mich Ave, close to bus routes, safety, etc) and more with a lower cost. Excellent location. Walked from Clark/Lake to hotel after taking a train from Airport (~0.4 miles). No issues - very safe. Cab driver didn't know that this hotel existed here and so surely a hidden gem. Next to walgreens (you can buy bus passes here) and subway. Bus stop is nearby also. Breakfast has same options everyday but plenty of variety. Cannot comment about the city views but there should be some higher up. Do consider this place for your stay. I'll definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mary Kay D
Reviews.Content: There should be no reason to stay in any other hotel when visiting Chicago. The service is great, the views from the upper level rooms sublime, the breakfast wonderful. The location the best. Fabuous attention to detail - and did I mention the price? WOW

Reviews.Title: “HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!”
Reviews.Author: Matt K
Reviews.Content: I was staying in Chicago with plans to propose to my girlfriend. Sales Manager Patrick Kennedy, David (who worked the night shift at the front desk), and their entire staff was incredibly accommodating in helping me do this in the best way possible. They helped me with every request and even suggested more, from room upgrades to ordering flowers to champagne. I will forever recommend this hotel to family and friends for their excellent above-and-beyond service. The location and view is perfect, and so was my entire trip!

Reviews.Title: “comfort hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: Jim M
Reviews.Content: I came here for my girlfriend's birthday. I enjoyed my stay, the location was great on Michigan Ave. with large spacious rooms and a great view of the city. The staff was extremely helpful especially Rachel who pointed out lots a attractions. Will definitely be coming back again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice folks & great stay”
Reviews.Author: bmb100
Reviews.Content: Just finished a stay at the Mich Ave location. The suite I stayed in was fresh, clean and quiet. The desk staff was very kind and helpful. Great location - walked to shopping and movies and had just an all-around great visit. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a great price”
Reviews.Author: MMWJD
Reviews.Content: This hotel was over $200 cheaper than the hotel holding the seminar I attended, so I didn't expect much, but I was pleasantly surprised. The lobby is minimal and very small, but who needs lobby space anyway. The staff were very polite and courteous. I stayed on the 22nd floor, which even on Michigan Avenue was very quiet and had a great view of the river. The room was very clean and had a complete kitchen, including dishes, silverware and cooking equipment. The bathroom was small but clean. It had a hairdryer, which I could not find listed as a hotel amenity, so I was wondering if there would be one. Would have wished for more room on vanity since there is not much room for toiletries. The mattress was comfortable, the closet was huge and had a free safe. A washer and dryer in the room! thought I did not use these. I didnt eat the breakfast, but the breakfast room look pretty small and kind of dark, but it would have been free, so can't be too picky. There were a few minor maintenance issues that should be addressed, the stopper in the shower didn't work, bath mat was peeling up. Small things. Overall, very happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Russell E
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here, after taking a red-eye and arriving at the hotel first thing in the morning. Even though the hotel was turning over at least half the rooms, they found a way to get us into a room by 11:30 AM. Steve Saenz at the front desk, and Nadeljka in the breakfast room were especially helpful and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “LOTS OF TLC”
Reviews.Author: rustyPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: We just arrived Nov. 17; we were early so our room wasn't ready but the young woman at the front desk was so helpful; she took all our luggage and then explained about which restaurants were close by and even had a coupon for us. When we returned from lunch, not only was our room ready but all our luggage had been taken up plus several boxes of materials which I had shipped earlier and which I needed for business meetings were also in the suite. The suite is huge and immaculate with floor to ceiling windows overlooking Michigan Ave. We have a full kitchen, big living room, bedroom, bath, washer and dryer. The amount of space is amazing plus breakfast is included. We are looking forward to this stay; with these accommodations and such a responsive staff we know we'll enjoy our time here.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Suites, Michigan Avenue, Chicago, IL”
Reviews.Author: Melissa K
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay here over the Halloween weekend. Great rooms! Wonderful staff - very helpful and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: theposterchild
Reviews.Content: Despite being right on Michigan Avenue at the river, you could walk right past this place and never notice it. My friends and family and I stayed there for my 30th birthday and it could not have been more amazing! The rooms were huge - each equipped with a full kitchen, stove, dishwasher, etc., and even a washer and dryer! The staff were more than accommodating and the complimentary breakfast was an added bonus. We were able to walk to our downtown destinations and save ourselves some cab fare. If you're planning a trip to Chicago I HIGHLY recommend staying at the Comfort Suites on Michigan Avenue!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good for business or pleasure, comfortable...”
Reviews.Author: Nance5612
Reviews.Content: Several times this past year we have stayed at this Comfort Suites for business. It is not fancy, but is simple, clean and comfortable. It is in a great location right on north Michigan Ave at the River. Near Millenium Park, shopping and dining. Each suite has a living room, kitchenette, and bedroom, also has in room washer and dryer. It is great if you are staying more than a few nights. They offer a nice simple breakfast included each morning also. Try to request an upper floor with a view if possible. Just a few blocks away is grocery store options if you wish to cook a little.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Professional Management and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Mike H
Reviews.Content: I love the location close to restaurants, shopping, transportation. LA Fitness right around the corner. Staff is very helpful and friendly. I have stayed here 16 times. Full size refrigerator, stove, oven, dishwasher, and microwave in suite if you don't want to take the short walk to fine dinning. Grocery near by. Here often for business but also bring the family on occasion. Plenty of room in suite for the whole family. We walk to museums and aquarium through the nearby park. Park and take the south shore line and you don't need to worry about parking. Train stop just a block away. Surprised with such attentive management in a big city environment. They have reasonable valet parking if you need it but no reason to drive when you are in the middle of everything. Great location for a bears football weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great view, great accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Lizabeth_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business and from everything to the front desk staff, room accomodations and location, I not only recommend the Comfort Suites for business travel, but personal travel as well. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: Joan W
Reviews.Content: The friendly and helpful staff made this stay great. Wonderful suite with complete kitchen, very comfortable. Wide variety at their hot breakfast. Great central location for us. Excellent value for the money. We will certainly stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Front Desk staff”
Reviews.Author: KibbleGR
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out the professionalism and courtesy of the front desk staff was superb. Very nice and spacious room (hard to find in this price range in Chicago). Convenient to most anything you want in downtown Chicago. The self-park garage was a short walk away. Continental Breakfast was above average.

Reviews.Title: “Good location,full kitchen, big suite”
Reviews.Author: CarolRio
Reviews.Content: The staff was great and friendly. We stayed for 11 days . The spacious beautifully appointed rooms make the place worth. It was nice walking distance from CTA and Metra. I recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and full kitchen!!”
Reviews.Author: karencarlet1
Reviews.Content: I went with 3 other ladies to shop and see Chicago. This location is perfect--right on the Miracle Mile! It has a full kitchen (including a dishwasher) and even has a washer and dryer. Breakfast was good and the staff couldn't have been nicer. Just a couple blocks from the subway (which I took from the airport) and train station (which brought my friends from another location). We'll book this hotel again when we come back.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: shllpwrs
Reviews.Content: We recently had a family emergency and needed a place near Northwestern Memorial Hospital that we could walk to. It was a terrible week for our family but the folks at this place were always cheerful and welcoming upon our return. David K. went above and beyond on our last night by printing out our boarding passes and had delivering them under our door for an early morning flight out. Thanks for the warm and cheerful place to come home back to in the evenings. We will return on our next trip to the windy city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Visit”
Reviews.Author: ajvm1999
Reviews.Content: I called the toll free number to book this room for a Friday and Saturday night. I used my reward night on Friday and reserved Saturday with my credit card. An urgent family matter came up around 1:00 PM on Saturday, and we had to leave. I went to the front desk to check out and expected them to charge me for the room since we left after the check out time and I had accepted the room cancellation policy on the phone while booking the room. The lady at the front desk did not charge me for the room!!! Also, the room was clean, had cooking and laundry facilities right in the room, the bedding was clean and modern, and the mattress was clean, too! If there was a downside to my room, it was the parking situation. But, it was expected considering the hotel was on Michigan Ave. Plan on about $35-$50 per day for parking near this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, great location”
Reviews.Author: mym2bw
Reviews.Content: I stay at Comfort Suites all over the US. This one was a treat. I appreciated the huge room, full kitchen and spectacular views. My husband and I have stayed at the comfort inn not too far away which is also nice, but claustrophobic compared to this lovely place. The front desk staff was gracious and the valet parking came off without a hitch. My only complaint was breakfast: far too crowded to enjoy. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Suites- Chicago- 2 Thumbs up !”
Reviews.Author: Klimjoe
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Stay in Chicago @ Comfort Suites. (10-22-10/26, Michigan Ave, near Wacker)) and I cant say enough good things about our experience. From the location, to the staff, even the free hot breakfast , you cannot go wrong staying at the Comfort Suites. The hotel was clean, the rooms and views of the city were great, and within walking distance, to everything. Even the subway was a short walk away, which I took to Wrigley Field for a tour. Was there for a convention and others attending stayed at another hotel right around the block and paid almost $300 a nite, with no amenities. You gotta be nuts not to stay here !

Reviews.Title: “Surprising value in great location”
Reviews.Author: scubed0127
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the Comfort Suites on Michigan Avenue. Super location a half block from the Hyatt where my conference was held at less than half the price. Super spacious suite including bedroom with King, Living area with pull out couch and kitchenette. Also, washer and dryer in the bedroom closet. Full breakfast included and the service was quite helpful. Not a super high end hotel, but clean, convenient and really an excellent deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dugan5
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by how great this hotel was. The rooms were very clean, the front desk staff was very prompt, accommodating and attentive to our needs. The location was ideal. Having a kitchen and separate seating area so we did not all have to go to bed at the same time was ideal with young children.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice”
Reviews.Author: dannlaly
Reviews.Content: First of all, I have to say that the staff was very nice and the location of the hotel is really good. And I have nothing else good to say about it. Breaksfast was from 6 (!!!) to 9 a.m. Although I understand some people are in Chicago for business, some are there for tourism as well. And it's not my idea of vacation having to wake up at 8a.m. to have breakfast. And boy was it crowded. They do advise us that it got really busy on the last hour, but were they really expecting us to wake up at 6 or 7am? And the hotel has something like twenty floors, with five apartments per floor, but ten tables for four for breakfast. No wonder it gets crowded (I counted back then and it was absurd, I just can't remember the numbers now). Our room was on the 2nd floor and it was big, but not good big, it was narrow big. It made no sense. It was a long walk from the door to the couches (living room area), passing by the room. And there was no wall between the room and the kitchen, so we had to sleep with the fridge right next to us (making an annoying noise). The bathroom was right on the entrance door and it was tiny-tiny and I wish they'd clean it better. The layout of the room was just strange. The floor's hall smelled really bad and when we complained about it they said some people cooked in the rooms and there's nothing they could do about it (but IMO the smell was not of food). My husband had a back problem because of the bed. First I thought he was exagerating, but then we switched sides and I got a backache as well. we checked the bad and the matress was not even as if there's a whole in it. We talked to the people downstairs and they said it was because they have some overweight guests (and if they do they should be prepared for that - which they are not). My husband really complained about it so they got us a discount - which was nice of them, I owe them that, but overall, I wouldn't recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay & awesome staff!”
Reviews.Author: Jo H
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a week long stay here.......cannot say enough good things about it! Everything was awesome....the rooms were fab, spacious with great views & every home comfort you could hope for. The daily breakfast was great....always fresh & plentiful. The location is wonderful....right in the heart of everything but quiet enough to be relaxing (I've stayed 2 blocks away on State Street & had to deal with the disturbing noise from the El & the traffic). But special mention must go to the fab staff....polite, friendly & with some of the best advice I've ever been given. All in all, my best stay in Chicago ever....thank you to everyone at the Comfort Suites for making it such an enjoyable & pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay in Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: drmike29
Reviews.Content: This review is long overdue. I had a very pleasant 5 night stay at Comfort Suites Downtown Chicago last year while in town for a meeting. The location is very convenient to numerous restaurants, shopping, and metro train system stations. I stayed on a mid level floor and the suite room exceeded my expectations. There are just 2 elevators, so the waiting time to get up and down from the lobby sometimes would take several minutes during the breakfast time hours. Otherwise, the wait time was quite reasonable. The front desk staff was friendly and always offered a welcome greeting upon my return to the hotel. This same staff offered great recommendations and directions for restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. Internet access was available in the lobby and in my suite. Adequate channel selection was available on the 2 televisions in each suite. I liked also the in-room safe where I was able to leave my laptop computer while I was away from the room. The kitchen area in the room had a full size refrigerator. There was also a washer/dryer/iron in the suite. This is a great hotel to stay at for business or for a family vacation. I have another meeting in Chicago October 2012 and I hope this hotel has available rooms for my next 5 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal - Good Place - Good View”
Reviews.Author: Joe_Longview
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Comfort Suites (320 North Michigan Ave.) for almost the entire year in 2010, and I recently returned for a 5 day stay. As before, the staff was very efficient, helpful, and professional. The rooms are clean with plently of space. If you're too tired to go out, the kichenette provides a great place for fixing food and staying in. The rooms on the NE corner provides the best views - Chicago Tribune bldg, Michigan Ave. bridge, etc. Comfort Suites is located within walking distance of many tourist attractions or a short taxi ride to others. Also, the free breakfast in the morning has a large variety of hot and cold breakfast items so you can start your day off right....very tasty!

Reviews.Title: “So helpful so far.”
Reviews.Author: travelingmomofone
Reviews.Content: Ok, let me start by saying I am leaving this before I have stayed here. Myself and two of my friends are staying here for a ladies weekend for my friends 50th birthday in two weeks. I have been emailing Patrick Kennedy about some things to make my friends birthday weekend special to her. He has went out of his way as of now to help me in anyway possible. He offered wine and cupcakes at his expense when I asked him for a room with a great view. I am so thrilled with the customer service. I am sure we will have an awesome weekend. I am so looking forward to this quick trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maria P
Reviews.Content: I recently spent one night at the Comfort Suites Chicago location and was very satisfied with the room/staff. I was lucky enough to get a suite on a higher floor and just loved the view of the city, and architecture. I didn't get to take advantage of all their accommodations as I was just there one evening. I arrived earlier than my check-in and they didn't have a problem. They took care of me right away, no questions asked. Overall, I had a great stay. Staff was extremely courteous and professional. Would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very caring and willing to help out!!”
Reviews.Author: Veronica S
Reviews.Content: I was trapped at the airport, my next flight wasn't for another 5 hours. I needed to get some sleep. I had tried other hotels in the Chicago area and explained my situation and none were willing to help out. They were going to charge me full rate. I walked into Comfort Suites expecting the same answer. I was extremely surprised when the gentlemen (James Stewart), offered to give me the room at a discounted price!!! I couldn't believe it..He was very nice and undertanding of my situation. I got my keys and went to my room. The room was very nice and clean. When I left' they had a free shuttle that took me back to the airport. Made my miserable evening much better!!! Thank you, James Stewart

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: Citygirrl123
Reviews.Content: Great long weekend in the windy city! I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: iheartowls
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that I am an employee at a Choice hotel. I know what guests expect from a hotel staff and the hotel itself. I was very happy with my stay here. I only stayed for two nights, but didn't want to leave! Location: It was smack dab in the middle of everything. Navy Pier is a five minute bus ride away. The train station is literally a thirty second cab ride away. There is tons of shopping and food choices within walking distance. The water taxis and Wrigley Building are less than a five minute walk away. The Walgreens and Subway next door made it easy to save money on quick meals and drinks to keep in the room. The Rooms: While the common areas are somewhat small, the rooms are huge! It literally felt like I had my own apartment in the city. They must have been apartments back in the day, as it is an older building. I had already expected the smaller areas, as it's a hotel in the downtown area, where everything is cramped. Imagine my surprise to walk into my room! I was placed on the 11th floor and had a corner room facing the water. Beautiful! The rooms are also very clean and included all the necessities, including a fridge, dishwasher, microwave, cooking utensils, and stove. The cleaning staff even washed my dishes for me! The Staff: Professional, friendly, and quick! They made sure to get my two rooms close together even though I forgot to request that. They even held our luggage for us for a few hours on the day we checked out, so that we could go to a couple museums before we left. The Value: I paid an employee rate, so it was worth the money a thousand times over. I know these rooms usually go for a couple hundred. Worth every penny! The breakfast is great. If you're looking for location and value, stay here! The Cons: The building has 26 floors and you may have to wait a couple minutes for an elevator (there is two of them), but not really a big deal. The breakfast area is small, but also just a minor detail. All in all, I had an awesome stay and will definitely stay again if I come back to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Business Trips”
Reviews.Author: Margaret P
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times and never was there a disappointment. Staff are very helpful, rooms are spacious and nice. My Guest Ambassador, David K. was there to help me from day one to the end of my stay. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone. The location is perfect for business or pleasure. Everything in in walking distance. I will be returning to the area again, and will definitly choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service On Michigan Avenue Chitown”
Reviews.Author: Remy C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I greatly enjoyed our recent stay at Comfort Suites Hotel, on Michigan Avenue â€“ in downtown Chicago. The efficient, affable and courteous service of the hotel staff made our business trip felt like a mini vacation. Particularly, Brian Rakow, one of staffs was very helpful in directing us to the decent restaurants and the main attractions. Great view of the Michigan Avenue strip from our room!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: LeeR81
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect if you are in Chicago for some sight-seeing - it's right on Michigan Avenue, just a 5-10 minute walk to Millennium Park, and right next to the Michigan Ave. Bridge and the Wendella boat dock (for touring the River/Lake). It seems to be right in the middle of anywhere you'd want to go - and it's a short walk to the L as well. The hallways are tight but the rooms are spacious and the beds are very comfortable. Very clean and good complementary breakfast. The bathroom was a little cramped but fine. Our room had a mini fridge, microwave, small stove, and washer/dryer as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: nosilla
Reviews.Content: Large nice room, not too expensive either! My son left his shoes in our room, and the sales manager mailed them to me- my son was so happy to get them back! We will stay again- it was super close to everything too!

Reviews.Title: “A Very Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: IndyMedic2006
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a very pleasant surprise. The front of the hotel is very simple just one block from the Hard Rock Hotel and Millenium Park and a stones throw from the Navy Pier. This hotel is a former apartment building converted into hotel rooms. So all of the room are suites with full kitchens, large living space, two flat screen TVs, washer/dryer, large closet in the bedroom with a safe, and free internet access. The staff, Amber & Leydi, were very friendly when I checked in and very helpful at chosing a place to have dinner. They even gave me a coupon for a free appetizer. With only 5 rooms on each floor, it was a very quiet evening which provided for a restful evening. The room was very clean and spacious. My only disappointment is that I was only able to stay one night. This would be perfect for anyone who will be staying for an extended period or a short period. Breakfast was also served in the morning from 6am to 9am. Don't pass this place up.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: WengChoyLee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Comfort Suites on North Michigan Ave for about a month. The location is excellent, and the room was very comfortable and clean. It's a basic hotel, and doesn't have a fancy lobby or special extras. But what was stellar was the staff. Everybody. From the ladies who come to clean your room, the maintenance guys you meet in the elevators, the front desk people. Staying there for a whole month, you get to know them, and they are genuine, warm and friendly, and really made living in a hotel for a month feel much less like living in a hotel for a month. I can't commend the staff more highly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: shropshireLorraine
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay, the location was perfect within walking distance of everything. Rooms were large had everything even some with cookers, washing machines etc. We had a nice view looking towards River. Don't be put off from the outside, not the most attractive of buildings, Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: sunshades1
Reviews.Content: Not just a 12x30 hotel room. These are oversize rooms with great views of downtown Chicago. If you want to spend a few bucks more, spring for the 2 bdrm. on the 26th floor. It is well worth every penny. The views are outstanding from the balcony, and the bedrooms!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel with Awesome Staff”
Reviews.Author: Eric D
Reviews.Content: We took my wife, daughter and babysitter to this hotel just this past weekend for a three night stay. It was exceptional. The location is perfect, the staff is friendly, helpful and very nice. We received an upgraded room which was a wonderful surprise. The room was definitely big enough to house three adults and one baby! The suite with refrigerator, stove and dishwasher is huge! The morning breakfast in phenomenal as well, you have to be there because it is a great start to the day. I would definitely recommend this hotel for families and business. A great place. I see also on a fellow review about a staff member named David. He is excellent and I was going to write to the management of the chain to tell them what an attribute he is to their hotel as well as their other staff.

Reviews.Title: “MY NEW FAVORITE CHICAGO HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Tampabay1954
Reviews.Content: We go to Chicago twice a year on business. This year we needed to find a new hotel as a night club had moved in next to our old one and for some strange reason I like to sleep at nights. Well, I have found my new Chicago home. Comfort Suites would get 6 stars if they had them. Great rooms that are beyond huge by Chicago standards; great location but the best part is the staff. Every single one bent over backwards to help us in every way possible. As a merchant I believe that the staff is always a reflection of the manager in charge so kudos. BTW, I almost didn't post this as I don't want this gem to get so popular that I can't get a room next time I go cause it's too full.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great city.”
Reviews.Author: Tom A
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is a great deal: good sized apartments with full kitchen and in-suite laundry in a great location; you can walk to lots of good restaurants, shopping and attractions. Only 5 rooms per floor so very quiet elevator lobby. Front desk staff were very helpful especially David Kavaliunas. We were upgraded to the 23rd floor with good view of Michigan Ave. Valet parking is at the Hard Rock Hotel just down the street which is a bit inconvenient but works. Full breakfasts were fine but breakfast room can get crowded. Overall great choice in downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: BobEA96
Reviews.Content: A small professional conference I was attending reserved rooms in the Comfort Suites for us and it was really marvelous. A family of four could have stayed in this suite, which had a fully-stocked kitchen and TVs in both the sitting area (with pull-out bed) and across from the bed. However, my room had no door between the bedroom and kitchen, so don't expect privacy if you're sharing with friends or family. A hot breakfast was included with the room and there were eggs and sausages, along with a waffle iron for making hot waffles (plus the usual cereals, juices, etc.). Our conference venue was about four blocks away, but I stayed an additional day; my last evening, I walked up to Water Tower Place and went up to the top of the John Hancock building, and on the extra day, walked down to Millenium Park and the Art Institute. There are tons of restuarants, museums, symphony hall, the Navy Pier, all easily accessible from this spot I found the staff very helpful. I got soaked walking back on my last rainy day and since I had checked out of my room that morning and left my bag, I asked if I could go back to the breakfast room so that I could pull out dry shoes and stockings, and this worked great. Along with the nearby restroom and coffee, I was able to dry off and warm up before my airport shuttle arrived. The staff were also helpful in providing maps and directions (my first day, I realized I'd forgotten to bring the address for my meeting and one of the reception staff searched the Internet for me --there are Internet connections in the rooms, but I didn't bring a laptop--wireless on the first floor. Altogether I would certainly want to stay here again on another trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: Kjjl4
Reviews.Content: Terrific suite hotel in a great location. The corner room was very spacious for our group of 5. Wonderful views of michigan ave and the river. We took the train to chicago, walked the few blocks to the hotel, dropped our bags off hours before checkin and went shopping. Staff was very accomodating with their secure storage room for luggage, quickly bring us extra bedding and towels, and storing our bags again after check out until we were ready for the train again. The kitchen area was nice to refrigerate our leftovers and enjoy cocktails before heading out for the night. The hotel corridor and elevators are not the best, but can be overlooked since their purpose is only to get you to and from our room and the lively downtown. This is our new favorite place since the price can't be beat, location was ideal for train station, millinium park and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and value!”
Reviews.Author: TashfromMelb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Comfort Suites for a week whilst attending a conference and I had a wonderful experience! Location: conveniently near the N Michigan Avenue bridge so you can walk down to the riverfront to the CAF architecture boat cruise and riverfront walk, go shopping along the Magnificent Mile, catch the 151 bus to Lincoln Park Zoo, ride the "L" from multiple different lines (only 5 blocks away from the Blue Line which runs direct to O'Hare international airport - extremely cheap and convenient), walk to the theatre district and other downtown sights including Millenium Park. Also, there is a Walgreen's pharmacy nearby (good for emergency snacks) and food outlets next door such as Subway and Chipotle (Mexican takeaway). Room: very spacious with an enormous lounge area and sofa, large study desk (extremely handy for conference travel) including ethernet access, fully-equipped kitchen including full-length fridge/freezer and coffee machine, large comfy bed with window views down to N Michigan Avenue (one of the corner rooms), TV in the bedroom and lounge area, washing machine and dryer and in-room safe, and small but well-appointed bathroom. Heaps of powerpoints to charging equipment! There were plenty of towels/handtowels and toiletry items. My room was extremely clean. Internet access: People have commented about the speed and connectivity of wi-fi and ethernet - I had no problem using both for laptop and iPhone. Breakfast: reasonable spread with fresh fruit, juice, coffee and tea, cereal with condiments, toast, bagels, muffins, waffle-maker. Because I had to leave early every morning, the breakfast room was not crowded and it was convenient to put everything on a tray and bring it back to my room to eat. Business centre: 2 computers connected to a printer on the lobby level was convenient for quickly checking email and printing last minute documents. Things for improvement: The main lounge area didn't have a main overhead light - you had to turn on the various lamps around the lounge area to get the room to be fully lit. The room didn't have a kettle (but contained a coffee machine) - I like to boil water for drinking. It would be great if there was a recycling facility for plastic bottles and paper waste. Overall: compared with the price of other hotels in Chicago, I thought the Comfort Suites was excellent value for a spacious room with a fantastic view in an equally fantastic location! I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and would not hesitate to recommend this place to others!

Reviews.Title: “Great location/staff and good value but noisy with slow WiFi”
Reviews.Author: Fried-Rice2
Reviews.Content: Our party of three stayed four nights at the Comfort Suites over a long weekend. The hotel couldn't be better located for a leisure trip to Chicago; just a short walk to the museums, the loop, and to shopping/dining on the Michigan Avenue. The lobby is small if you're used to the fancier hotels downtown, but the rooms are larger in comparison to those we've had in other downtown hotels on earlier Chicago visits. We had booked a 2 queen suite, but were upgraded on arrival to a huge 2 bedroom, 2 bath suite (If you're reading this Comfort Suites, thanks again). The room was clean but the furnishings were dated and due for upgrades and new carpet. We noted a leak at the toilet which was quickly repaired on the day we notified the front desk. The front desk was very attentive and responded quickly to any request we made. The room had a full kitchen, which we used for dinner comfortably one evening after a trip to Trader Joe's a few blocks away. Our biggest pet peeves were noise and WiFi access. You expect outside noise in a city like Chicago, but most of the noise was internal from the A/C system or from the appliances in the kitchen area. We did find that it became white noise quickly and it didn't keep me from comfortable sleep. However, if you're a light sleeper it could be an issue, especially in the front bedroom which is separated from the kitchen by an open doorway with no door. WiFi is provided but for most of our stay the connection ranged from barely usable to not worth trying. Breakfast was the average budget hotel quality and the hot options were lower quality than what we're used to. It's OK if you want cereal, but we found ourselves across Michigan Avenue at Cafe Decartes for excellent coffee and pastries. Despite our peeves, I considered the Comfort Suites a great value considering that it was by far the lowest cost option for downtown Chicago for a room that could house three adults comfortably. We weren't expecting the Ritz, and the location was great and the staff as attentive and helpful as we've had at much fancier hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, nice room and that's it!”
Reviews.Author: Morumbi
Reviews.Content: My first impression was negative, arrived there after 12 hours flight and no one to help me with the luggage, the reception was very busy as it is small so 3 guests already make it crowded. The guy who was "taking care" of me looked like it was his first day there he was repeating all my questions to have time to figured out the answer I found it very annoying anyway, I've asked him where I could get a US sim card and he said that he didn't know so I asked where I could find a Tmobile shop and he said the address as I was a local and knew the city so I asked him to right it down and he gave me that look... so on top of that I asked him for a map of the city and again he gave me that stupid look... anyway my room was not ready and to be honest I just want leave that reception I didn't care... for my surprise just next door there was a mobile shop! Back talking about the hotel; the room is very nice the bed super comfy and thats it, the elevator takes hours to arrive, there is only 2 including the service one to take care of the whole building and the breakfast couldn't be worse, its so poor a small room with cheap furniture and plastic cups and plastic plates, I didnt feel that I was in Chicago it looks like you are in a 3 star hotel in East Europe sorry to say. I wouldnt stay there again even though the room was nice but hotels for me are the whole experience a nice and friendly staff, a quickly check in, helpful concierge and also see interesting people in the communal areas and there forget about it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: DeeOwe
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect for the magnificent mile and the park, and easily within walking distance of the pier and sears tower. The suite really felt like an apartment. Kitchen with breakfast bar overlooking the living area. Perfect for early morning tv with coffee and bagels. Reception staff were a mixed bag - some very polite and attentive, others a bit standoffish. Breakfast room is too small for the size of the hotel, was extremely busy between 8:30 and 9 (all seats taken)- i suggest you get there before 8 and take things up to your room. Only other quibbles would be that the furniture is a little dated, but everything was clean, and the lift sometimes took a while since there were only 2.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: irem d
Reviews.Content: Nice location, clean rooms, helpful staff, good price!

Reviews.Title: “The Comfort Sweets”
Reviews.Author: Amber L
Reviews.Content: The Comfort Suites is a sweet hotel and excellent value. The room (we had a Queen Suite on 22 floor) was massive and had a full kitchen, laundry (wonderful surprise for weary and dirty travelers) and lounge room. The bedroom and lounge had great views of the city. The room was a little dated but quiet and so well priced we didn't mind. We didnt ever make it to the breakfast, the breakfast room looked pretty dark and dreary. The Hotel has a fantastic location, within walking distance to shopping, the river, the lake, Millennium Park etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service & breakfast for the price”
Reviews.Author: StanfordPlanner
Reviews.Content: Not a four star but great location if you're a tourist. Included breakfast is very good. Front desk has been friendly and helpful. Rooms a bit dated but clean, beds comfy. FYI, if you need a wine bottle opener bring it with you. They're not in the otherwise well furnished kitchens and you can't get one from the front desk...also hard to find to buy locally! We finally found one at 7-11..

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: pinkpixipetals
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about this wonderful little hotel! The room was clean, great view (we had a room on the 12th floor corner facing Michigan Ave), and the location was perfect! A short walk to evrything in Downtown Chicago! This hotel is wonderful and the price is even better!!! When I come back to Chicago, I will make sure to stay at the Comfort Suites! Thank you to the staff that made our stay so enjoyable, we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: DDDFJD
Reviews.Content: We had to return to the check in desk 3 times before our room was ready. The hotel had been sold out the night before thus cleaning was a little slower than usual, we were told. Our room was nice & roomy although the bathroom was smaller than we were used to with Comfort Suites. The only ice machine for this 26 story hotel was on the 1st floor & the elevators were slow so it was more than a notion to try to get ice. The breakfast was nice as was the front desk personnel. The bed was extremely comfortable. Appreciated the hotel's $5 off parking discount on self-park per day. The room certainly had everything you could ask for including a washer/dryer & complete kitchen. The construction taking place all over Chicago caused some comotion early in the morning but that's not the hotel's fault~progress. The location on Michigan Avenue was extremely convenient to everything Chicago has to offer. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in a central location”
Reviews.Author: JamesDeanHunter
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 4 nights at the Comfort Suites Chicago (chosen based on Trip Advisor feedback) and were extremely satisfied. Strengths - Location - very central and easy walking distance to most tourist attractions, and close to trains and buses. - Price - we booked and paid an online rate that was on sale and paid a very reasonable rate. We then extended for an extra night at the beginning and they offered us a very competitive rate for the extra night and we were able to stay in the same suite for the whole stay. - The staff is very friendly and helpful. We were checked straight into our suite on arrival at approx 12 noon, and they were always very friendly every time we spoke with them. We arrived at breakfast just before 9am one morning and the attendant kindly went to the kitchen to bring out some breakfast for us and some other guests who were also there late. - Suites - our suite was very spacious and it was great to have stove/oven, microwave, dishwasher/dryer, room safe, 2 tv's, full size fridge, plenty of space. We were on the 6th floor overlooking Michigan Ave and these suites appeared to be longer and had the view over the Ave, so recommend you request one of these suites. We did not find the room noisy at all. We did not have the problem with the lifts some have reported, and found they were fast and we rarely had to wait for them. - Beds - extremely comfortable and I was finally able to get over my jet lag and get a great few nights sleep. - Wifi Internet - worked perfectly and easily Weaknesses/Opportunities There was so many great things about the Comfort Suites it is hard to find anywhere for them to improve. If I had to find an opportunity for them to improve it would be the following minor things - Breakfast - it was a bonus having breakfast included. The range was good - cereals, fruit, eggs, waffles, bacon/sausage, breads/bakery items, yoghurt, juice. The breakfast room was small and every day we went down it was standing room only and difficult to find a seat. We did tend to go down between 8.30 and 9am so I suggest you try and go earlier if possible, or take your selection back to your suite. - Bathroom - considering the large size of the suite the bathroom was very small. However considering the amount of time you spend in the bathroom this is a minor issue unless you plan to spend a lot of time there! - Room Cleanliness - Our suite was very clean and the smoke free environment was a bonus. The only issue we had was one of the cushions on the armchair had a stain on it and when I flipped the cushion over it had an even larger stain on the other side. I also found a hair that wasnt one of ours on one of the clean bathroom towels when we arrived. Both of these issues were not major issue for us but would be an opportunity to improve. Overall we were very happy with our stay. The value for money, location and friendly staff all made this a great choice of hotel and I would recommend it for anyone looking for a good sized clean room in a central location. We would definitely stay here again when we return to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great rate and fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Trvl1961
Reviews.Content: Booked a one night midweek stay a couple weeks prior to our trip. The TA reviews were once again spot on and helpful. The suite was large and had a view of Michigan Avenue. There was a spacious sitting area with a chair, sofa, flat panel tv, and work desk. The kitchen was equipped with a frig, small stove/oven, microwave and dishwasher, coffee maker and all pots/ pans and utensils needed to cook and eat a meal with. The sink had a large counter that accommodated two barstools for dining. The bedroom also had a wall mounted tv, roomy closet, a stackable w/d and iron. The bed was comfortable and a choice of feather or foam pillows. The bathroom is small but not an issue for us. We did not partake in the breakfast downstairs but the room was full of folks who did. It offered the standard fare both hot and cold. We would indeed stay again at this hotel if we return to Chicago. It had easy access to transit and shopping. The front desk was helpful and printed our documents when the guest printer was out of ink. If you are looking for clean and affordable, the Comfort Suites is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “CONFORT SUITES... A NAME A GUARANTEE!!”
Reviews.Author: YvonneRoma
Reviews.Content: Our first experience at a Comfort Suites Hotel was last year in Otay Mesa (San Diego suburbs) .Despite the very desert area where the Hotel was located , our stay was so positively surprising that we decided to book the same hotel chain this year too but in Chicago this time. Once again our experience exceeded our expectations!! We spent 1 week and were lodged at the 7th floor. Well, despite the exterior side of this hotel seen from the street is really nothing special (much more beautiful the one in Otay Mesa) , the apartments are incredibly comfortable: very clean and fully equipped (kitchen, laundry and drier machines, safety box).The hotel is located in Chicago downtown at 5 min walk by the beautiful Millennium Park! Staff at the Reception is very friendly and helpful. Despite kitchens in the aprtaments, breakfast is included in the price and itâ€™s very good and rich . Moreover, as the breakfast area is not enough wide to contain many people seated at the same time, guests are allowed to bring food in their apartments which, sometimes, can be helpful especially during crowded hours. All in all I can say that our stay was very pleasant at the Comfort Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Accomodation and new Go-To!”
Reviews.Author: Greg B
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night and couldn't be happier with my selection. The suite was clean, roomy, and well planned out with a bed separate from the reset of the space. Two TVs, a comfortable kitchen and clean bathroom. Couldn't ask for more. The staff is just a pleasure to deal with. Accommodating beyond my expectations when they offered to store my bike in the break room and check up on my level of comfort throughout the short stay. Very respectable when I took my time checking out. Thanks Gavin and the rest of the team!

Reviews.Title: “great space great location quick and easy”
Reviews.Author: cathyalgas
Reviews.Content: If you love a larger room without the craziness of a huge hotel, the Comfort Suites on Michigan Ave fits the bill. Our room had a view of the River from the bedroom and living room space, we could have ordered in and had all the comforts of home. But we did venture out on foot as we had restuarants, theater, art and night life all within blocks.The hotel was clean, easy to get around and staff was very helpful with directions and suggestions. Looking forward to the next visit to Chicago and the Comfort Suites!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Artin S
Reviews.Content: Just came back from 5 nights at this hotel. Great location ... awesome getting a suite at this price ... included breakfast is a bonus. However, free wi-fi hardly every worked, but there is an ethernet cable that works. Minor complaint: The bathtub was blocked when we got in ... it was unblocked the same day at our request. However, for 3 consecutive days we asked for it to be cleaned, and it was not. Not a big deal if you don't mind a patchy bathtub. Would I stay here again?
