Possibly ... for families on a budget who don't want to stay at a hole in the wall ... it's tough to overlook the size of the room, the location, and the overall value. P.S. Most comfortable pillows I've ever had the pleasure of laying my head down on.

Reviews.Title: “Average, but understaffed and some serious problems”
Reviews.Author: EPmom13
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in August during Lollapalooza. The hotel is an older building, with 4 suites on each floor. Our room had 2 walls of windows, which was great to look out on the city. There isn't much of a lobby - it's a small hotel, but there are plenty of convenience stores around to get what you need. There is a washer and dryer combo in the bedroom, and a small kitchen. One note - it is located right on Michigan Avenue, and the traffic was very loud at all times of the night. My biggest complaints: my family left the hotel for the day around noon. When my husband got back around 6, the door was left open. Not only unlocked, but propped open with the swing-lock. I understand that accidents happen, but this is a HUGE security problem. Nothing was taken, but it really upset me. I reported it to the desk, and they just responded that they would talk to housekeeping. The second problem we had was getting housekeeping (or anyone else) to bring us blankets. We unsuccessfully asked 3 times - twice at the desk and once on the phone - for extra blankets for the pull-out couch. Every time they said they would send some right up. When I went to the front desk to complain about the door being left open, I asked again. They finally sent someone up. I understand the hotel was probably full due to the concert, but this is inexcusable. I think the hotel is critically understaffed, and am worried that security problems like we encountered probably occur quite often as a result. The hotel is decent, however, the problems we had were significant enough that we most likely won't return.

Reviews.Title: “"We loved it and we'll be back"”
Reviews.Author: logas666
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband and our special needs son loved the service, the room was nice and very clean, pots, pans and dishware were all there, and what a great included breakfast. Location, Location Wow right in the heart of downtown Chicago near everything and we mean everything. But no swimming pool. Aslog666@gmail.com [--] We are proud Canadians

Reviews.Title: “Always well taken care of...”
Reviews.Author: ssssscincinnati
Reviews.Content: When I travel to Chicago this sis the only place I will stay. I have had some difficult times traveling to this large city over the past four years. When I found this Comfort Suites things became easier. They remembered me. The staff always makes me feel welcomed and well taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “little gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: aldela
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have stayed at the Comfort Suites on many occasions The most recent being Aug 6th & Aug 18th&19th The staff is very helpful & friendly the suites are always clean & very comfortable the location is fantastic and it's a great value Next time we are in Chicago that's where we'll stay Mr & Mrs S

Reviews.Title: “Great location and I reccommend it highly”
Reviews.Author: mbking111
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very accommodating to all our needs. It was centrally located to all transportation and within walking distance of lots of activities. The staff was fantastic. Convention that I was attending was .4 of a mile and our accommodations were a much better deal than even the convention rates for the hotel where the convention was being held. If I'm ever in Chicago again I plan on staying at the Comfort Suites on North Michigan Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the service”
Reviews.Author: gocelts1986
Reviews.Content: Never, I repeat, never, have I ever experienced the personal attention I received at this hotel. The director of sales (Patrick) and sales manager (Kristina) went over and above to make sure that my stay was the best it could be. I was upgraded to a 2 BR suite and they bought me tickets to a Cubs game (which I reimbursed them). Their willingness to help plan my days were unparalleled. This hotel is a tremendous value, considering its ideal location on Michigan Avenue and its price which includes a small breakfast. I recommend it without any reservation.

Reviews.Title: “didn't live up to my expectations”
Reviews.Author: ahm5885
Reviews.Content: Perhaps my expectations were a little too high after reading glowing reviews here and on Yelp but I thought this hotel was merely satisfactory. We stayed here a few weeks ago while we were in town for a wedding and although I was not expecting luxury (it is a Comfort Inn after all), I was definitely expecting it to be one of the nicest Comfort Inns I've stayed in, and I don't think it was. Location: Location really can't be beat - in the loop, on Michigan Ave, near the river and Near North Side. This is one of the primary benefits of the hotel. Rooms: Although the rooms are all suites, they are not much bigger than a standard hotel room (it looked like a normal hotel room but with a wall between the bed and couch). I think the room would be fantastic if you are staying for a week or more, because it includes a fridge, microwave, mini-stove and washer/dryer. As a family, you could definitely save quite a bit of money by not having to go out for every meal. HOwever, we were only in the city for a couple days and wanted to go out to eat, so we didn't take advantage of any of the extended stay features. I also thought the room looked a bit dated. While it was perfectly clean, they were some stains on fabric and scratches on appliances or furniture so it didn't look super modern. We were on the 10th floor and had no view to speak of (a tiny slice of river, but mostly parking garages). Breakfast Buffet: This hotel includes a complimentary continental breakfast and even though the selection is similar to most other Comfort Inns (make-your-own waffles, eggs, toast, muffins) I found the quality not that great. Staff: The staff was pretty friendly and was very helpful in recommending a nice beach within walking distance. They did give us incomplete directions when we asked how to get to the airport on the El. Misc: -Internet was free and worked very well (wifi & hookup) -Elevators were very small and horrendously slow, which made getting up to the room a pain sometimes - its hard to walk up 10 flights of stairs! -Hotel is totally smoke-free, which is awesome!! -No pool :( Bottom line: We had a perfectly pleasant stay here, but I think you can probably get an equally nice room for less money ($170 per night on a summer weekend with a AAA rate), especially if you're not super concerned with location (we wanted to be within walking distance of the wedding venue).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, we'll stay here again”
Reviews.Author: JanH775
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in July for 2 nights, coming straight from the airport on the Blue line we found the hotel not too bad to walk to from the station and it was so close to everything we didn't need a car until we left Chicago, the only time we needed to use the train was to get to the Cubs game. The suite was huge and had everything we could possibly need, including a washer and dryer, and we had a wonderful view from the 24th floor of the river and Michigan Avenue. To give a balanced review, the only down side was the internet, which was barely accessible from our room. Breakfast was typical of free breakfasts everywhere, and we bought our own healthier fruit option, but having said that we don't choose a hotel on the quality of its breakfast, or even its internet service, and next time we visit Chicago, this hotel will be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Just great!”
Reviews.Author: OsloOsloNorway
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a week during Lollapalooza. First of all. The location of this hotel is just brilliant. Just make sure you go the right way to the bars, so you dont end up in the business area. Secondly, the rooms are gigantic. We enjoyed the suite in the 26th. floor, and found it truly amazing. With everything we neede. Only thing I would like to point out, was the Wifi-connection that lived its own life sometimes. Despite this, we had a great stay. Staff were brilliant, and we would happily come back to Comfort Suites. Greetings from the Norwegian army.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value in Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: tmccaleb
Reviews.Content: We had a clean, spacious suite on the 19th floor with a view of the Chicago River and North Michigan Avenue--windows on two sides. The suite was quite large, including a kichenette and living room, a separate bedroom, a large closet, a washer and dryer, and a small but adequate bath. The location was perfect, about 10 blocks north of the Art Institute, between the Loop and the Miracle Mile. We walked everywhere. The room was quiet, the bed was comfortable. The only negative is the breakfast room which was too small for this size hotel and therefore quite crowded. After fighting the crowds to get to the food, many guests took their food to their suite. After the first day, we found breakfast elsewhere. We got a very good price compared with other hotels in the area and in similar locations in other cities.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Adrifx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Suites on North Michigan Ave. in August for 2 nights. The hotel is perfectly located just 1 minute from Chicago River and near to almost every â€œmust seeâ€� of Chicago. We didnâ€™t have to use any public nor private transport during our stay. Hotel staff was very friendly, helpful, and provided everything we asked for. The room was like an apartment, it had full kitchen, washing machine, tumble dryer, and everything to make you feel more like in home. Our apartment had great views to Michigan Ave. Beds were very comfortable. Breakfast offers hot waffles, breads, coffee, juices, fruits, hamburgers, baconâ€¦ and some other things I may forget. A perfect way to start a day. The only cons we found were the elevators; there were only 2 and it gets very busy in peak hours. And the Wi-Fi signal was poor and we had to move near the front door when we wanted to use it. We parked our car in a parking lot just around the corner (next to the river) which is cheaper than the one provided by the hotel. We loved this hotel and we will definitely be back when staying in Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Amazin stay...very nice location...oustanding service...”
Reviews.Author: Jovanigava
Reviews.Content: I was thre couple weeks ago and this is one of the best hotels I have stayed at...The service is very good..everybody is so atentive and friendy...the location is just perfect,you have everything around in downtown are walking distance...It is definily my first choice when I go bck to Chicago....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location~~Comfy, Huge Rooms”
Reviews.Author: TallahasseeLassie_7
Reviews.Content: We have rarely stayed at Comforts Inns, but this was a true delight. The hotel is located in the heart of Chicago~just a short walk from transit stops and many of the sites that we were interested in. We had a gigantic suite on the 19th floor overlooking Michigan Avenue and the river. We found this location through Trip Advisor. I was first concerned that there might be noise from the street, but that was minimal. The only downside was that there is no parking. We had dropped our rental car three blocks away and picked up a second one a few days later, so this was not a problem for us. The breakfast was a bit of a zoo, but since we are late risers that was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice place”
Reviews.Author: grbenjam
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights during Lollapalooza weekend. We had a suite with a bedroom and a pullout sofa. Plenty of room with nice kitchenette. Rates were a little too high on Fri and Sat, but that was due to Lollapalooza.

Reviews.Title: “!st Time Chicago Trip”
Reviews.Author: AliciaLosAngeles_CA
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Comfort Suites on North Michigan Ave., with my family, and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. After a very long drive, we checked in to the hotel close to midnight, and the evening staff was attentive and quick to check us in. The refrigerator was not working (needed for medication), however, the staff was very accommodating and placed the medication in their refrigerator until morning. Early the next day, the refrigerator was replaced, with the medication being brought to us. Location is perfect, and within walking distance to Walgren;'s (next door), Navy Pier, and Willis Tower (formerly Sear's Tower.) Breakfast offers waffles, breads, coffee, juices, fruits, eggs and sausage, which was perfect to start a day of sightseeing. Room size was very generous, complete with a kitchen, washer/dryer, and three closets, one of which was a walk-in. Suggest more hangers in the closets. Had a room overlooking Michigan Ave (15th flloor), and heard street noise, but that was what we expected in exchange for the great view. Although Wi-Fi is free, it was very difficult to obtain. Later when we called, we were told to try and access near the kitchen, which worked. Suggest adding this info in their WiFi log-in sheet. Great day and evening staff, always attentive and informative. Highly recommend this hotel and we plan on returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic play to stay”
Reviews.Author: ledg387
Reviews.Content: Beautiful large rooms with a view down Michigan Ave. Full suite with kitchen and laundry facilities. Friendly, helpful staff. Full control over ventilation system in the room. Valet parking was excellent. We didn't have to worry about parking the car. We walked everywhere, the Navy Pier, the Theatre district, restaurants. Two minutes from the river walk and river and lake tours. We'd go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “A dissenting opinion - not the greatest”
Reviews.Author: intrepidad
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here without hesitation based on really great trip advisor ratings. This was not a terrible property, but it was not up to the level of most places I have stayed in Chicago or places I have stayed based on trip advisor with no where near as good ratings. The positives were: staff was freindly and helpful, location was exceptional particularly if you plan museum grant park type stuff. There are a fair number of decent dining options right near by. The room we had (a suite for family of 4) was entirely functional, and had laundry and kitchen in room. The breakfast is about what youd see at most any Hampton or Holday Inn - but crowded the days we were here. No real complaints about any of this. But this place has some serious drawbacks. It is very cramped throughout (though less so in the rooms proper) the elevators are very small, often stuffed to capacity during our stay and often slow to arrive. The view from our room was awful, but we knew that coming in and this did not bother us much. The lobby is not hideous but rather follows the very small, even claustrophobic, and drab theme of the whole place. The basic problem with this place besides that it is cramped is that it feels quite long in the tooth. Hallways are kind of puke green with traces of a bad paint job on hardware fixtures. Loose door knobs and carpet well toward end of usefully life. Dated wallpaper and furniture. Our room did not feel all that clean and had a very soft lumpy mattress. I found somebody s gummy bears between the headboard and the mattress when the remote fell in there. This place has location and basic functionality, but other than that feels like a low end property and not worth the hundreds per night we paid. I was not aghast but I wont stay here again, either.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service. Excellent Venue!”
Reviews.Author: deseraecc
Reviews.Content: This review was mistakenly posted on another Comfort Inn site. However, this is the REAL DEAL! I have stayed at this property several times and am never disappointed by the quality of the customer service and the wonderful rooms, regardless of which room we get. The beds are like sleeping on clouds. I actually regret that I can't spend more time just lounging in the bed, watching TV. It's like a home away from home, though I don't have a fireplace! I recommend this property to all of my Chicago-bound friends. The service is top rate!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - but that's it”
Reviews.Author: Poss62
Reviews.Content: Spent an interesting 3 nights â€“ loved Chicago but thought the venue was below par. Given how much we spent per night (over $300 per night) the property was definitely the worst overall on our trip. On the plus side, having washer/dryer facilities was good. The location meant that moving around Chicago central was easy. On the minus â€“ the bed was billed as a king, but was definitely a queen. We were on the 6th floor and suffered the smells of smoking in halls (we guessed that this was the floor where smoking was allowed). Our toilet blocked and overflowed daily which was beyond uncomfortable. The included breakfast in the tariff was in a windowless room. Food quality was dreadful, making McDonalds seem high class. There are much better properties on offer in Chicago at better rates. We made the booking based on TripAdvisor ratings but when we arrived the bad far outweighed the good. Staying on Michigan Avenue was great â€“ the property not so. Two creaky lifts (which we waited up to 5 minutes to arrive) are inadequate for the property. If you like uncomfortable couches, a small TV and your toilet constantly overflowing then this might be attractive. This was the most expensive property of our cross US/.Canada trip and the most disappointing. While the reception staff are attentive, they do not make up for the lack of amenities. There are far better options in Chicago â€“ loved the city, hated the accommodation!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: drabu
Reviews.Content: The location is incredible and with a very willing staff. The apartment has a ktichen and the rooms are spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for a better location”
Reviews.Author: BookLady6635
Reviews.Content: What a find - really well located and on an extended business trip so great to have the washer & dryer, the extra space - the great desk/workspace and a fridge to keep drinks etc cold. The breakfast is a wonderful convenience and the staff could not be more pleasant or helpful - I will definately be back and will recommend to my collegues. Mr. P. Kennedy was very helpful and is a great promoter of this fine establishment!

Reviews.Title: “good value & great location”
Reviews.Author: ikapl
Reviews.Content: clean and great location with helpful staff - minor inconvenience was waiting for the elevators

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: mom22preemies
Reviews.Content: We looked for a hotel that would put us in the heart of Chicago without breaking our budget. This hotel exceeded our expectations. We were staying in Michigan with family and wanted to spend a night in Chicago in a location was convenient to various kid-friendly activities. I spend endless hours on the internet comparing different options and decided to go with Comfort Suites because of the good reviews on this site and its combination of good location and (relative) affordability. It was also important to me to find a hotel with a true suite. We have 2 small children and don't like to be in a situation where we have to turn the lights out and go to bed along with them at 8:00. Comfort Suites had true suites with a separate bedroom and door that could close. When we checked in, we were blown away to learn that we had been upgraded to their presidential suite. We now had 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, a full kitchen, washer, dryer, living area, 3 TVs and a view overlooking Michigan Avenue for our original price. Talk about ensuring guest satisfaction! We took a short stroll with the family to Millenium Park where the kids played in the fountain and admired the Bean. From there, we went to dinner just a few blocks away at Giordano's for authentic Chicago deep dish pizza. The next day, we took a short cab ride to Navy Pier to enjoy the children's museum and Ferris wheel. The location simply was unbeatable for our needs. The staff were fabulous and extremely responsive. We got to the hotel a little early and our room was not ready, so the staff arranged to store our bags so we could find ways to enjoy ourselves without being loaded down with the bags. Valet parking is at the Hard Rock Hotel, but the Comfort Suites staff quickly met us with a luggage cart and brought our bags the half a block to the hotel. We asked for a crib when we checked in and it was whisked to our room right away. My few words of caution would be to manage expectations about the common areas. It's a reasonably priced hotel on Michigan Avenue, so something's got to give! The lobby is small with just enough room to check in. The breakfast area is adequate, but during prime breakfast hours, it's a zoo. And the fitness room is nothing to write home about - 3 cardio machines and a universal weight machine. These slight drawbacks, however, didn't put a dent in my enthusiasm for the room, location and price. I definitely would recommend it and certainly will stay there again on our next trip to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “best hidden treasure hotel downtown!”
Reviews.Author: SarahMcGrath1
Reviews.Content: I love this specific Comfort Suites on Michigan Ave!! I was very hesitent with the name at first, but this is the exception to the rule. The front desk staff was so very friendly and I felt like they actually cared to talk with me and get to know me. The room was fantastic and had a great view! And there was no need to get up early and head out to breakfast, the selection there in the hotel was beyond great. The room was very clean and smelled good, which isn't always the case with a Comfort Suites. I will definitely be staying with Comfort Suites again and have already reccommended this to several friends that will be making the visit to Chicago later this year! Love it!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing"”
Reviews.Author: anvil1
Reviews.Content: We were excited to be downtown Chicago, but this hotel did not live up to billing. The room's internet did not work, there was no toilet paper, and we did not receive any towels after the first day. All of those problems were corrected after we complained. The "full" breakfast is simply a continental breakfast, and a mediocre one. The breakfast room was way too small and understaffed for the amount of guests. I put 2 stars simply for the staff, which was pleasant and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “I'm wondering why I'd stay anywhere else downtown”
Reviews.Author: Drinkwater11
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, nice friendly service, and clean rooms at a decent price...what else do you want? Two minor drawbacks are you have to valet at nearby "Hard Rock Hotel" which is just around corner and there are few amenities on site (such as resturant/bar).

Reviews.Title: “We loved this place....so close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: sombrero6
Reviews.Content: The week of July 17, 2011 our family had the opportunity to stay here. The front desk was most helpful in everything we needed. We have no complaints at all. A very nice breakfast was provided every morning, and we were always able to find a table. The front desk people are superb....they were able to guide us to whatever bus stops we needed. We bought the city bus pass for 3 days, for around 15.00 and we went all over Chicago. We also took advantage of the City Pass which got us into 5 venues, the Planetarium, Field Museum, Museum of Science and Industry, the Shedd Aquarium and the Skydeck at the Willis Tower, This also provided us with no waiting in lines! Our suite was huge, with a full size fridge, washer and dryer,stove and microwave oven. It's right near the Michigan Ave Bridge. You won't go wrong in chosing this hotel. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Staying downtown Chicago can be easy”
Reviews.Author: RoscoToronto
Reviews.Content: Location is absolutely the greatest selling point with this hotel. Right on Michigan Ave on the south end of the Magnificent Mile. Hotel shows relatively new, clean, and organized. Rooms are of the generous size and come with kitchen and laundry included. We had the double queen bed suite and the main room with both beds still had ample room left over to move around. Service was great, called for help with toilet and more towels and both were handled within 10 minutes of calling. Now the "not so good" criticisms. Parking only available offsite. Several nearby secure spots are available but nothing less than $35/ day self parking. No stopping on Michigan ave, so hauling your gear is required. Bathroom was the smallest i've encountered ever. Could barely fit with room to spare and when you travel with 2 teenagers, it made for some careful coordinating shower times. Free breakfast, nothing is free without a price and that price is congestion and dealing with the throngs of other families with small out of control children all vying for some make your own waffles and toast. Like most free breakfast deals, timing your arrival to breakfast is a gamble so spare yourself the aggravation (unless it's just coffee you need) and go to the Corner Bakery Cafe around the corner and really enjoy a satisfying start to your day. Overall, the location and room size wins over the other minor problems and I would recommend this hotel easily.

Reviews.Title: “Great Locatation, Great Value, Great Space,”
Reviews.Author: Thither47
Reviews.Content: Comfort Suites was among the most affordable choices in downtown Chicago. We ultimately chose it for the convenient location. After being in Chicago for a week, we now realize how convenient the location truly is. There are not many hotels in Chicago that are actually on North Michigan Ave. With the Comfort Suite, you walk out the door and you are right on North Michigan about a hundred yards south of the Chicago River, with hundreds of restaurants and hundreds of shops within an easy, interesting, safe, walk. Also huge in our consideration was the spacious room. We were staying a week (family of three) and the extra space made the time in the hotel much more relaxing. Each suite has a kitchen and a washer/dryer. The washer/dryer was a Godsend. There may be other hotels in downtown Chicago that offer a washer and dryer in each room, but I couldn't find them. Comfort Suites my be unique in that regard. Some hotels offer laundry service, with the associate cost. At Comfort Suite, you can do it yourself - at your convenience. The room was very clean, as were the common areas. The breakfast was as expected. The staff was friendly and considerate. Should we ever again need a hotel in downtown Chicago, the Comfort Suites at North Michigan Ave will be our first choice. We were on the 18th floor in a corner room and had some great city views.

Reviews.Title: “Very Suprised, Great location, Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: Fightfyre2
Reviews.Content: Perfect location! Close to shopping, the river, Soldier Field, Wrigley Field, etc... We were impressed as soon as we walked in the door. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was huge and nicer than expected. Overall, great hotel, location, and staff.

Reviews.Title: “I wanted to give it a 4 but funky smell and bad water pressure was not cool.”
Reviews.Author: 42forever
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Chicago for 5 days for a conference. I was solo and thought the room would allow me to get some groceries and be a perfect home base for the conference. I took the train into town and knew that I would have to get out at the Hard Rock because they were not allowed to stop on Michigan Ave. It was a short 30 sec. walk to the hotel. Upon check in, the front desk clerk was very nice and gave me the lowdown. I was on the 14th floor on a south west corner room. Got to the room and found it to be spacious! It was like coming home to an apartment. I started to unpack right away and then started to notice a slight funky smell. It was like a dead animal smell. I searched everywhere, but could not find it. I thought it was the kitchen, but it was not. I thought it was a "City Smell" thing. When I went to buy some snacks at the walgreens on the corner (there is also a Subway next to door too), I bought a scented candle and that did the trick. KITCHEN: The kitchen stocked will all the necessities to cook a meal and feed 4 people! The appliances looked a little dated. But it was pretty good size and had a large counter to use. LIVING ROOM AREA: Nice TV with spacious loveseat with pillows. Comfortable. The closet for hanging clothes and the dresser was in this area, but it was no big deal. Had a safe too. BEDROOM: Had a great view of other hotels, and the large buildings and up michigan ave, so that was cool. No lake view though. The bed was comfy with lots of pillows. The washer and dryer were in the bedroom closet with a iron and ironing board that were immaculate. Usually the water filler is missing or the board is burnt. Everythign was is great working order. Plus there was a TV in the bedroom too! BATHROOM: This was the major downer. It was a workable size, but it needed counter space. Got in to take a shower and the water pressure was a joke. One morning at peak time, it was dribbling water out while I was soaped up. I mentioned this at check out when I checked out and Patrick said they were having problems with the Hot Water. Gotta get that fixed for sure! Never took advantage of the free breakfast. The elevator was the slowest elevator in Chicago. At one point I watched it go up and down for 20 min before I got to my room. Just not cool. It is an older building and is no way new. But I enjoyed my stay. Everyone was always nice and the cleaning people did a great job. My wife would have not stayed here with the shower and smell situation!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for business trip”
Reviews.Author: WeatherWife
Reviews.Content: This was our second time using Comfort Suites-Michigan Ave for our business trip to Chicago and we were just as impressed as the first time. Sales Manager Kristina Soukup listened carefully to what our business needs were going to be and delivered on every count. The rooms were generous, with sitting areas that allowed us to meet comfortably with clients. A complimentary hot breakfast with many offerings allowed us to eat and get back to work without losing a lot of time and the hotel is bang in the center of many excellent restaurants and walking distance to Millennium Park. Twenty-four hour front desk facilities allowed us to fax documents to our office at 3AM. Staff is pleasant, professional, and willing to go the extra step for its guests. The midnight staff even collated and stapled a business document for a 6:30AM meeting deadline , of their own accord, when then sensed we were running late on time. From start to finish, this is the hotel you want if you have business in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Second chance”
Reviews.Author: Resmama
Reviews.Content: I was a bit disappointed last time I stayed here, because of the lack of wifi and/or other working internet connection. And that time I was there for work - and I really needed it. This time, however, it was vacation and less need of internet, so I decided to give Comfort Suites a second chance. Good news were that there was wifi in the hotel now. Not great, but still a wifi. The room/suite was as great as last time. I love it! Location is PERFECT. Service is good. Now there are only two other drawbacks with the hotel. One is the chaotic breakfast. It is great with breakfast included, but this is too chaotic for my taste. Especially in the summer. However, I do not really mind making my own breakfast, so I can live without the one at the hotel. Second - and worse - is the fitness room. It is depressing and I really wish there were some free weights, dumbbells, a mat or something except a multi-functional machine. And yes, I know I am picky. I will probably go back nevertheless. There are a lot of things I really like about this hotel and I LOVE Chicago. And maybe there will even be some dumbbells the third time, just as there was a wifi this second time.

Reviews.Title: “This is one great hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelwhisperer53
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a trip to Chicago and had the pleasure of staying at this little gem in the heart of Chicago . When you are on Vacation you can look no futher because this hotel is all about location location location. You are in walking distance of everything. The staff are so helpful at giving you ideas on how best to see the city wither it be by a double decker bus or by one of many great cruises .If you are travelling by train you should do the water taxi which will take you very close to the hotel and the ride is very relaxing and stress free.The beauty of the room is that it is fully equiped with a full kitchen. Fridge stove washer dryer dishwasher and microwave.It also has a ironing board and iron as well as a safe to place passport in.There is also a free breakfast.. I really enjoyed the whole experience .and you will to !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravel555555
Reviews.Content: Fabulous room on the 24th floor with a balcony overlooking the river. Perfect location for enjoying the downtown life. Close access to the water taxi to take us to Navy Pier and the Shedd/Field Museum campus. We enjoyed the free breakfast every morning. Spotless room, large kitchen and living areas, and friendly/helpful staff. Thanks, Steve and Rachael! Loved our stay and we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Clayton_NCKaren
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great staff, and a perfect location. We were just steps away from the action. The room was perfect, the breakfast a great start, and everyone was so friendly. I was overwhelmed that there was not one bad experience during the week I spent there.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago's Finest!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Eugene_033
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Chicago and therefor always difficult to choose a place to stay. We almost booked another hotel when i came along the Comfort Suites. Turned out they where also on Twitter so i send them a Direct Message. Got the correct answers within 30 minutes, together with the reviews i decided to go for this place. It must be a good place and.....it is!! The location is great, check in went lightning fast and the room was awesome. This was no room...this was a suite!! We where on the 22nd floor, had a corner room and great views towards the river. There is really nothing to complain about, maybe the breakfast room is a bit small but this all depends on the amount of guests who are there. Rooms are very clean including the bathroom! And the best of it all....the location and price!! Go left for one block and you are on Magnificent Mile. Go right for 3 blocks and you are at Millennium Park! We had a great price deal for which we thank Natalie Furka-Padgett. Big Time!!! She was so nice and it was really unfortunate that we did not meet each other in real. We just missed each other! Friends of ours are going to Chicago in August and they will def. book at this place!! And if we will return to Chicago in the future, and we will as we fell in love with this city, for 300% we will stay at this hotel again!! Thanks again for making our stay in The Windy City unforgettable! Kind Regards, Eugene (Eugene_K @ Twitter )

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, I felt like I was home.”
Reviews.Author: cycle1031
Reviews.Content: Overall, a great experience, for my partner and I. We recommend and will be back. Excellent for work travel stays. Especially great for locals with family in town who might not want to join them out on the town for the weekend nights. A great retreat from the hustle of the city. We pulled up and were a little bit thrown off with the location of valet services. Once we found that it was the same service as the Hard Rock Hotel, whose valet service is not very proactive about helping guests, we were good to go. Upon checking in we were greeted by a friendly hostess who was able to quickly check us in despite handling multiple phone calls. We got to our room and found it to be very homey for a hotel. (Not to be interpretted as cramped). We were pleased to find a clean refrigerator/freezer which was key as we brought home ice cream and left overs from dinner. The hotel is located close to many great dining establishments and in short walking distance to the River North/State Street night life scene. Additionally, we had used a gift certificate and Patrick was wonderful to work with. We needed to split the certificate into (2) 1-night stays and he was able to make it happen with no fuss. Another example of employees at this hotel able and willing to help all their guests. All in all, we were pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Chicago!!!.”
Reviews.Author: purpleknif67
Reviews.Content: Pro's--LOCATION!!! Last-minute walks and late-night bar hops were no problem. The room itself was very clean, modern with a full kitchen, 2 bathrooms, wide-screen t.v.'s in each room,plenty of closet/storage space and a washer/dryer in the room. THE RATE!!! considering we were staying in downtown Chicago, the rate was more than reasonable. Con's--slightly funky set-up with bedroom space near front room=minimum privacy, still, I don't think I would ever stay anywhere else in Chicago, hands-down. The breakfast area was a bit cramped and very busy but considering it was in the rate, it was more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room & location!”
Reviews.Author: ACK123
Reviews.Content: Our family of three recently stayed for four nights at the Comfort Suites and could not have made a better choice. Our room was spacious and spotless and the location afforded us easy access to all of Chicago's top attractions. The in-room kitchen was very much used and appreciated. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for top-notch, yet affordable, accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: cosmopolitan1
Reviews.Content: Excellent location on Michigan Ave. My suite was like a 1-bedroom apartment. The kitchen contained even an oven and a stove. There were 2 flat screen TVs (one in the living room and one in the bedroom) and a washer and dryer unit in the bedroom closet. Breakfast was included and very decent, although seating is limited in the breakfast room, which can be a problem on weekends. The only problem I encountered was finding the entrance to the hotel since the building is very narrow and the hotel name is not displayed prominently. I will definitely consider this hotel again on my next visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: travelingwurd
Reviews.Content: Do yourself a favor and stay someplace else. I have no idea why the reviews are so good for this place. No water pressure. Slow elevator. Smelly garbage in the hallway. There is no free wifi - never did connect. Cheap towels/shampoo/soap. Business "center" is a corner of a busy hallway. Horrible. The only good thing was the view and the square footage of the room.

Reviews.Title: “#1 Best hotel in Choice Hotels”
Reviews.Author: ourstay1963
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were at this hotel from 6/13/11-6/17/11 and we enjoyed our stay. The kitchenett and rooms with washer and dryer made us feel at home. All of the staff were helfpful, pleasant and professional and maid service was excellent. We chose this hotel because it is located in the heart of Chicago's Downtown. Transportation, restaurants and walgreens near the hotel. The stores on the manificent mile " will make you want to shop until you drop." we were able to tour all of the place and events we had planned. We had only one concern about the homeless and panhandlers we encountered standing in front of walgreens store asking for money. We mistakenly went down the stairs leading to the underground passageway and discovered homeless and panhandlers down there. we thought that the stairs were leading to the Subway as in New York City. In addition, walking North on North Michigan Ave we observed several young women sitting on the sidewalk with signs stating that they were pregnant and hungry. A young man with a child also had a sign asking for money. We felt safe all times at this hotel and we were extremely greatful a safe deposit box was in the room for personal items. Again, we enjoyed our stay, but felt uncomfortable encountering homeless and panhandlers in the dowtown area. New York City had the same problem in the downtown area with the homeless and panhandlers approaching tourist. However, we no longer have this problem, because businesses in the dowtown area complained to former Mayor Guilliani. New York City Police has made this area a safe place for tourist to visit. We realize that Comfort Suites cannot resolve the problem with panhandlers and the homeless alone. it takes the entire community to resolve the problems. satisfied New Yorkers

Reviews.Title: “Location is great, service is excellent, staff is friendly, big, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: flintstone2
Reviews.Content: We will definitely stay there again. Location is great, staff is very friendly and rooms are big and clean!

Reviews.Title: “Another Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sharpera
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice this year and they never disappoint! If you are looking for clean, spacious rooms located right on Michigan Ave for a great price then this hotel is perfect for you. Thanks Comfort Suites for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but hotel a disapointment.”
Reviews.Author: sandra23035
Reviews.Content: This hotel had great reviews thats why l choose it, room okay, but musty smell every time we entered the room, one night toilet blocked up about 10pm, was sorted out straight away. Small bathroom, shower over bath. A lot of noise at night with sirens, and noise from other rooms. Kitchen was well stocked with appliances, washer etc. Even though the breakfast was complimentary it could have been better, one morning no eggs, plastic knives and folks, not enough room if everybody came down at once. Also had to go and tell reception that our room had not been done. Would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I stayed at this hotel with a group from Quebec....we'll be back for sure”
Reviews.Author: helenetravelagent
Reviews.Content: I escorted am small group of tourists from the Montreal area and we stayed at the Comfort suites 4 nights. I can tell you that everything was perfect. The check-in was very quick.Mr Kennedy was there to welcome us and he gave us information about the hotel.The location of this hotel is fantastic. Walking distance to Millenium Park, museum, shopping , good restaurants. If you need to use public transportation you have bus stops in front of the hotel . Do not hesitate to buy a 3-day pass. With this pass you can use buses trains as often as you want.The rooms are huge and equipped with fridge stove, microwave.The continental breakfast is very good too.The staff is well informed.If you need any information concerning restaurants or attractionsn they will be happy to help you. I recommend this hotel without hesitation and I am looking forward to returning next year.Thank you to all the staff

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay in Chicago - Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: MominIndiana5
Reviews.Content: Our family came to Chicago after my son's college graduation. We arrived at the hotel early and the staff was able to hold our luggage until check-in. That afforded us the opportunity to go out and sightsee. The staff gave us much needed guidance to explain travel on the train so that we were able to get around the city. When we arrived to check-in, we were pleasantly surprised to be on the 26th floor - we had been upgraded! The views from this room were absolutely amazing - we were able to see the Chicago River and the Millennium Park all from our room! The accommodations in the room were above and beyond anything that we had anticipated. Every service at the hotel was a 10. The staff was wonderful, friendly, helpful and professional. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who visits Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service and Can you Believe Price & Location??”
Reviews.Author: jwknoefler
Reviews.Content: Very outgoing and responsive staff. Excellant location, in the middle of everything! Walk to Grant Park, take an architecture tour on the river, walk & shop the Magnificent Mile...and all for a reasonable price!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for business, good for family too”
Reviews.Author: kiwi&yank
Reviews.Content: My hubby and our three year old stayed here for almost a week. I attended a conference and hubby and bubby entertained themselves. We were really satisfied with our stay. We got a great rate online (direct from hotel), the location is fab - you can walk to the Golden Mile, museums, parks, and convenient for me to catch a conference bus from the Hyatt (around the corner). Great, affordable, quick mexican take-away restaurant two doors down too (Chipotle or something). We booked Comfort Suites because I knew we'd be keen on the kitchen and separate living/dining (and washer/dryer) which all turned out to be great. Really was a full kitchen (stove, oven, microwave, full size fridge, etc). king size bed in the bedroom was super comfy and fold-out couch suited the 3 year old (most nights, when he wasn't in our bed). Washer/dryer not bad but the dryer outlet dumped in to a bucket (supposed to catch condensation?) so we steamed up the windows whenever we did a load of laundry. Not a huge deal, and with a/c we appreciated a bit of extra humidity. Living room was small but adequate. Bathroom was also small but fine. We had a small problem with the plug (non existant) - called down to Reception, maintenance came within minutes and solved within 10 min later. Sweet! Staff at the front desk was very friendly. Not particularly helpful in terms of local recommendations, but seemed to be keeping an eye on things and generally tried to help. Breakfast was pretty average (toast, make your own waffles which others seemed to like but wasnt' my fave, yogurt, some egg offering, juice, coffee, apples and sometimes other fruit) - but, heck, it was free and very convenient (down stairs) so we picked up a few bits and pieces most days. Starbucks and Walgreens also only a block or so out the door. Again, very convenient. Bigger supermarket was 2-3 blocks away and still a bit of a 'city supermarket' (ie. not a great selection of nappies and baby stuff!) but we were able to stock up for lunches and would be great if you were adults (lots of yummy looking deli food and ready-made, easy to heat up meals). It's an odd tall, skinny hotel. So 20+ floors with 4 rooms on each floor. We opted to not pay for a view so faced out the back - but still could see peeks of the river and our toddler loved looking at the cars in the back allyway 17 floors down. We found it pretty quiet too. But then I suppose you should ask our neighbors as we were probably the noisy ones with the small child. Our neighbors seemed friendly, so hopefully we weren't too bad. 2 computers with internet access behind the reception. Sometimes busy but generally you could get in. Toddler and I visited the gym and it looked decent (although all we did was run matchbox cars off the back of the treadmill - luckily no one in there). If I was alone on business I would have been more than happy. Also had a stationary bike and elliptical machine and some weights. Overall we were really pleased - I would recommend, and we would go back again. Great rates, great location, comfortable and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “This place was AMAZING!!”
Reviews.Author: kleon17
Reviews.Content: The best part was the view from my suite it was gorgeous! I would LOVE to be back ASAP!

Reviews.Title: “Balcony Suites and Bang for Your Buck!!!”
Reviews.Author: evietois
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Comfort Suites on Michigan Avenue for our 5th Wedding Anniversary over Memorial Day weekend. We had a huge suite with an AMAZING balcony overlooking Michigan Ave and the Chicago River. We were welcomed by the super-friendly and helpful staff (Gavin, David, Steve, Aes and Aaron were the best!) and couldn't believe how spacious our room was. We had a full kitchen (dishwasher, microwave and a stove) AND a washer and dryer in our room! We were in walking distance to everything we wanted to do. Stay at the Comfort Suites if you want to experience the magnificence of Michigan Ave without the pretension!

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy for me”
Reviews.Author: expectant customer
Reviews.Content: I had a room high up in the sky. Good size - a lounge, and a bedroom. Issue was noise from the street over 2 nights - Chicao police/fire sirens woke me up, several times. Just too much street noise gets into the room. A shame. Coffee in room, iron and board, 2 x TV's. Bath and shower all OK. Nice comfortable bed. Breakfast on ground floor - OK.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in the city.”
Reviews.Author: Spoilers
Reviews.Content: We recently booked this hotel room for our dear friend's bachelorette party. We searched for many days for any room in the loop, as hotels all over the city said they were booked. It came down to a handful of hotels, but we lucked out and the comfort suites had a single room left - The executive suite. We were told that there would be a king bed and a pull out bed and that if we were quick, we could snag a roll away or two for no additional charge. We looked at some photos and a very helpful youtube video showing what the inside looks like, noting the full-sized kitchen would be excellent for continued drinking throughout the night. Although pricier ($500/night after taxes) than the simple double rooms that you see on priceline, we understood that we were getting quite a bit more than a simple double room already and sealed the deal. When we got to the hotel room, we couldn't have been happier with the decision. To begin, the hotel bumped us up free of charge to the presidential suite. This suite is on the 26th floor. It can best be summarized by calling it a two-bedroom apartment. In fact, some of the attendees noted that the hotel room was probably bigger than their apartments. Two bedrooms with king beds in each, two full bathrooms, a washer/dryer, full-sized kitchen, dining area with an actual dining table, living area, loft complete with spiral staircase to access the loft, and a balcony with a great view of the river and the Chicago Tribune building. The location was great. We were able to walk to everything that we needed in the city. The rooms were clean. Even our resident clean freak (the bride!) loved it. The staff was great, and completely put up with a gaggle of drunk ladies with great humor. Without a doubt, $500 was a steal for this room. tl;dr - Pricier than the base room cost at other hotels, but significantly less expensive than anything else comparable. Great location. Clean rooms. Friendly staff. Full-sized kitchen. Free wifi. Washer/dryer in-room. Great view. Would repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Cold weather, Warm staff”
Reviews.Author: nicolerudat
Reviews.Content: This hotel was like a little hidden gem, across the street from Millennium park and close to the gorgeous shopping district. The front staff were super happy to help me out with every little stupid question I had! The room was fully equipped with all of the luxuries of home including a washer and dryer which was helpful for drying my wet clothes after being caught in the rain. Breakfast comes included with all the standard fixings expect for one surprise, a waffle maker!!!! I highly recommend peanut butter with bananas on your waffles, Yum! The coffee flowed endlessly, the beds were too comfy to leave, and the office center was handy to print out my e-tickets. I had a great time in Chicago thanks to Natalie and her amazing staff. I will be staying here the next time I come down, its like a home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “It was a really good experience”
Reviews.Author: Pinkali1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel this april. We took the Kings suite and we are overall pleased with the hotel's service, rooms, location and amenities. The wifi in the room was very useful. The microoven and refrigerator also helped as I had a three year old child with me and I could make some food for her in the room itself. I thought it was a good value for money and it was because of staying in this hotel that I could see so much in a weekend. I wrote a detailed review in yahoo. Read if you wish... http://www.associatedcontent.com/article/8043355/hotel_review_comfort_inn_and_suites.html?cat=8

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed everything about this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: audreydunn
Reviews.Content: This property was advertised as a special through Travelzoo, but since the deal was a non-refundable room, we were able to book an AAA special for a couple of dollars more. The staff was super friendly (one receptionist addressed my husband by name throughout our stay!). The rooms were extremely spacious, remodeled, clean, and surprisingly very quiet at all times. The location, right on Michigan Avenue, was ideal and convenient to all attractions. We took the subway from the airport, and the walk to the hotel was a few short blocks. The breakfast was adequate and hardy. I honestly can't think of one negative thing to write; it was our first time to Chicago, and we'll certainly be back. It is a wonderful city with so many things to do.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: legend30
Reviews.Content: The service and the staff of this hotel is outstanding. The location cannot be beaten in downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: mom21708
Reviews.Content: This was our family's first Family Vacation. We had a wonderful time. The room was very clean and comfortable. The minute we got to the hotel the staff was very helpful. They told us where we could park our car and checked us in very quickly. When we got to the room we laid down to rest and the bed was so comfortable. We had a kitchenette which was helpful because we have a young child so we could store his meals and milk. Breakfast was plentiful and delicious. We enjoyed our stay very much. We stayed downtown on Michigan street. There were great restaurants nearby as well as great shops. We visited the museum and aquarium. We also went to the John Hancock Observatory and Wills Tower. We had such a great time we stayed an extra night. The staff was wonderful at accommodating us for an extra stay at the last minute. I have nothing bad to say about the hotel except there was construction nearby going on early in the morning somewhere nearby the hotel and it would wake us up, but we realized the hotel couldn't do anything about it. We are going back this summer and we will be staying at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: mitchellaustralia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in April so we could visit musuems, navy pier, skydeck etc. The location was perfect as we were a few blocks from the train & metro line. The front desk staff were adequate but did not go out of their way to make you feel special as most Hampton chain hotels do. The foyer and elevator lobbies are very cramped but once you go into your your room you are greeted by a huge multi room type of suite. The decor is old but still clean and welcoming. The view from our 6th floor facing Nth Michigan Ave was good although the windows had not been washed for many months. Breakfast was included which included a good selection to start the day with. I booked online a few months earlier to save some money. If you need a large room for a family then this hotel is perfect. There was also a washer/dryer in each room.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for an Awesome Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sharpera
Reviews.Content: My best friend from college and I had a guys weekend in Chicago the weekend of March 18-20. We stayed at the Comfort Suites off Michigan Avenue in downtown Chicago. I found this gem of a hotel online but still wanted to be sure I knew what I was getting my self into so I checked the reviews on Trip Advisor. Almost all the reviews on Trip Advisor were positive, so I made our reservation. When we arrived, we of course checked in, and while checking in the gal who checked us in stated "we have a surprise for you". I thought "oh boy what does this mean?" I asked her "what surprise"? She said - we have upgraded you for free to the PENTHOUSE SUITE...Our jaws dropped to the floor at that point, we were stunned. So we got checked in and when we got to the room we could not believe it...It was awesome! We were on the top floor (26th) & had a balcony with an awesome view of Michigan Ave. The suite itself was awesome - we each had our own bedroom and bath. There was a kitchen, fridge, living area with sofas, washer/dryer, flat screen TVs, everything 2 buddies on a guys weekend could ask for. And to top it off it was spic & span clean. The location of the hotel is great - close to a 7/11 where we bought some liquor and a there was a Walgreens right next door. Also there are some restaurants close by that made it easy for us to grab lunch. The staff was very courteous and helpful. They really made our stay in Chicago that weekend wonderful. I will be going to Chicago again this summer and I will definitely be staying at this hotel. I am recommending this hotel to anyone who asks me where to stay in downtown Chicago. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and spacious suites”
Reviews.Author: lp321
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Comfort Suites for an annual girls weekend. We booked the hotel due to the central location and huge suites, but our experience went well beyond what we expected. The staff was friendly, the rooms were very private and clean, and the daily breakfast was great! My favorite part of the stay was the view - the floor to ceiling windows overlooking Michigan Avenue and the Chicago river just can't be beat. I'll definitely recommend Comfort Suites to my friends and family whenever they are in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel experience I have had.”
Reviews.Author: DonRobF
Reviews.Content: I have traveled a lot - throughout half the world and this was by far one of THE best experiences I have ever had. The reception and check in and the Bellman were all happy and pleasant and most importantly solicitous of my needs. I loved the experience - Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Why would you stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: Sarah094
Reviews.Content: I'll admit, we considered a staying at the Drake or Swissotel for our anniversary trip, but my research kept leading me back here. Where else can you stay in what feels like a spacious apartment with a gorgeous view (even from 5th floor) and still have the peace of mind that you aren't spending an arm and a leg for it? After walking through a couple of other hotels, we were still happy with our choice. The location is perfect...between the Mag Mile and Millennium Park. You have the convenience of Walgreens next door, Starbucks down the block, and the Wendells River Cruise tour is just across the river. We walked everywhere. I can't imagine that we'd have been as comfortable anywhere else. The front desk staff adds to the experience with their welcoming smiles and eagerness to help. Why would you stay anywhere else?!

Reviews.Title: “Spring break”
Reviews.Author: Mysti55
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a wonderful place! We had the king bed one room suite. It was perfect. Full kitchen was a huge help with the kids. The rooms were clean and had a nice view. The staff was very helpful in what ever we needed. The only down side was the computers in the buisness center were not working. The breakfast was nice but some times ran out of certain foods. The location was great. It was a wonderful stay and vacation for the entire family.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Audra35647
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a short getaway and it was even better than we imagined. We were greeted promptly and warmly by the front desk staff. Our room was so spacious with a spectacular view of Michigan Avenue. Because there is a limited number of rooms per floor, it is very quiet and relaxing. The hotel is walking distance to many sightseeing destinations, shopping, restaurants, and nightlife. We will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for health-conscious business travel”
Reviews.Author: jillinois1
Reviews.Content: Great location and lovely views. Be sure to memorize the address, because most cabbies don't know it. The suite layout lets you work in one room, sleep in the other, which really helps those of us who don't sleep well away from home. The bathroom is small but servicable, which is fine by me; I'd rather have the space elsewhere. Closets are very roomy. The kitchen and the floor space in the living room are my favorite features: I bring healthy food from home to heat up after a long day of work. If you spread two towels on the floor (there are extras in the cabinet under the TV), you'll have plenty of room to do yoga and stretches. (Doing yoga on the floor of a hotel room, even with towels, gives you a very close perspective on room cleanliness -- these rooms are clean and the rugs smell fresh.) Staff is very friendly and responsive -- they've saved me from a torn hem and a lost phone charger, and have always accommodated early check in when I request it.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for an Awesome Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sharpera
Reviews.Content: My best friend from college and I had a guys weekend in Chicago the weekend of March 18-20. We stayed at the Comfortt Suites off Michigan Avenue in downtown Chicago. I found this gem of a hotel online but still wanted to be sure I knew what I was getting my self into so I checked the reviews on Trip Advisor. Almost all the reviews on Trip Advisor were positive, so I made our reservation. When we arrived, we of course checked in, and while checking in the gal who checked us in stated "we have a surprise for you". I thought "oh boy what does this mean?" I asked her "what surprise"? Also there are some restaurants close by that made it easy for us to grab lunch. The staff was very courteous and helpful. They really made our stay in Chicago that weekend wonderful. I will be going to chicago again this summer and I will definitely be staying at this hotel. I am recommending this hotel to anyone who asks me where to stay in downtown Chicago. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Excellant location..”
Reviews.Author: Lorraine087
Reviews.Content: Very much enjoyed our stay-everything you could possibly need to make it a home from home for a few days... Thank you...

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean, friendly, great location”
Reviews.Author: awcolley
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly on every encounter; the hotel common areas and room were clean. The room (we had one with 2 double beds) is like a studio apartment with a fully furnished kitchen (even a dishwasher), a stacked washer/dryer, and a large walk-in closet. The bathroom is small and nothing fancy; with the toilet & bathtub/shower in a separate room from the sink/mirror (which are in the same area as the washer/dryer and walk-in closet). There is a good-sized LCD TV. There are five rooms per floor, and ours was the one in the front middle. The other four rooms are corner rooms with views on two sides. Our view was of the buildings across Michigan Ave; though from right next to the window you could see the Chicago River and even the top of the Hancock Bldg. The breakfast is typical Comfort Suites food (just warmed up on-site), and does include the make-your-own Belgian Waffles. The eating area is somewhat small and was always crowded when we were there. They do provide trays (in your room) for bringing stuff back if you want. Although it will take several minutes (only 2 elevators, almost always busy) to get back to your room, you have a microwave there to reheat stuff. The location is great, just a few blocks from and El station and the Metra Millenium Station (and Millenium Park), bus stops within a block, and taxis always available on Michigan Ave. It's less than a block from the Michigan Ave Bridge over the Chicago River, the southern end of the Magnificent Mile. The only hassle is parking. Valet parking is available half a block south at the Hard Rock Hotel entrance ($36/day plus tips). Public parking (both do-it-yourself and leave-keys-with-attendant) is available for $35/day at 111 Wacker, a block from the hotel (this option allows you access to your car to get things you forgot to unload). There is no loading zone at the Comfort Suites entrance, you have to go to the valet parking area to just drop people off. So be prepared to drag your luggage for at least half a block in Chicago weather. This hotel is not cheap; but it is much less outrageously priced than anything within several blocks, even flea-bag hotels. The "Business Center" is two computers and a printer in the hallway between the lobby/elevator area and the fitness center/breakfast area.

Reviews.Title: “amazing value”
Reviews.Author: funseeker058
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a weekend getaway in the city. while making my reservation i requested a queen bed and a room with the view. the price came up and i thought oh, okay, great, so i booked it, without really looking further. i was shocked at the suite we got at such a decent price. the view was beautiful at night, the location was right in the middle of everything. highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience!”
Reviews.Author: happytravelers011
Reviews.Content: We had the most wonderful stay at this hotel. We arrived early and wondered if we could check in to our room. The man at the hotel check-in said he would check. No, it would not be possible to get into the room we booked early, but he may be able to upgrade us into another room. Yes, he said I can upgrade you and you can get in now. Wonderful, we would be able to drop off our bags and begin our walking adventure. When we got in the elevator, we noticed our room was on the top floor. This usually means a pretty nice room. When we opened the door to our room, we couldn't believe it! He upgraded us to the best room at the hotel for the same price! We were excited! With my husband and I, our teenage daughter, and her friend we were so delighted to have two seperate bedrooms and baths, a full-size kitchen, dining area, living area, 7 large window views, and a outdoor patio/balcony. It was amazing! We were only there for a short day and half trip, but ended up spending more time than we expected in our room, because it was so fabulous. The only bad thing was that the heat did not work the greatest - okay when we arrived but by 6 p.m. it had gotten colder and would not heat above 68 degrees. We managed. We could not complain - eveything else was perfect! Great location, too! As a thank you, we have already reserved another night at this hotel in the Fall.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, location with breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: anitad7
Reviews.Content: Comfort Suites is an ideal place to stay but I am afraid to tell anyone -- I may not be able to get a room next visit! Great rooms, views and service with continental breakfast and good coffee!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value, best location, spacious rooms, amazing staff!”
Reviews.Author: kme123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 18 months ago, and liked it so much that when I knew was visiting Chicago again this was the only choice - and I'm so glad I came back! I was very late getting to Chicago - my train was delayed by 8 hours - and when I contacted the front desk to tell them that I was on my way and not to cancel my reservation, I was reassured by the very friendly staff. When I eventually arrived at half past midnight, the welcome I received was lovely. The room was amazing, with great views of the Tribune building, and I couldn't get over how big the room was. The bed was very comfortable, I had everything I needed to cook, and the washer/dryer was the icing on the cake. Breakfast was also fine, although I'm glad I didn't wait till the last minute to go down to get it, as the food was running out! This hotel would be perfect, apart from a couple of little things: - there's only two lifts, and there's 25 floors. This meant having to wait quite a while sometimes to get on the lift, and this wasn't helped by the cleaning staff wheeling their carts on at the same time as people were checking out. My suggestion is that the staff either bring the carts up early, or wait until after the checkout/going out rush to bring them up. - the server at breakfast was quite abrupt - which surprised me as the rest of the staff were so pleasant. - Free WiFi was great, as was the computer and printer in the lobby. However, the WiFi didn't work in my room on the 21st floor. These are all minor things though, and overall this is one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in. Next time I'm in Chicago I'll definitely be booking this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value! Huge suite in the perfect location for the right price!”
Reviews.Author: MadMomof2
Reviews.Content: We travel to Chicago often always staying in a suite to accomodate our group size that at different times includes our kids, friends, or other family members. We've stayed in the Embassy Suites (both locations), The Omni, Homewood Suites, Marriott Springhill Suites and others that are not as easily coming to mind. The Comfort Suites on Michigan Avenue ranks among the best of any of these all suite properties mentioned. The location is perfect - right in the middle of Mich Ave and State St shopping, a short walk to amazing restaurants and bars - we spend most of our time in River North but you can walk anywhere from here. Our room had a balcony with beautiful views of the river and Wrigley Building. And as an added bonus breakfast is free - We will stay at the Comfort Suites on our next trip to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to bring in the New Year!”
Reviews.Author: matvc3
Reviews.Content: A few of my friends and I stayed at the comfort suites for NYE 2010 and we were so amazed by the suite that we booked. It was beautiful, plus we had a great view of downtown Chicago. The suite was clean from ceiling to floor. The kitchen, bathrooms, and bedrooms were spotless!!! The staff at the hotel were awesome, they did not hesitate to assist us when needed. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We shall return!”
Reviews.Author: Laughgram
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at this hotel. The staff is friendly and very helpful. The front desk staff greeted us by name the next day. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The bed was great. We were visiting our granddaughter who lives in Chicago. There was plenty of room for her to visit us and just hang out. The kitchen was handy for storing and eating our leftovers. The hot breakfast was good, but go early since it gets crowded you can take your food to your suite as well. Great location. Make sure you read the parking instructions on the hotel web site. It was not a problem but you need to know ahead of time. As usual, we had wonderful meals in Chicago. We shall return and stay at the Comfort Suites on Michigan again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome City Views and a Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Erich75
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. The suite was very roomy; plenty of space to sleep or entertain 4 comfortably. The views were outstanding! The free breakfast was good, albeit pretty crowded when we ate. The elevators were adequate, although we did have a little bit of a wait during the breakfast rush. The staff was very friendly; they even held our bags the day we checked out, as we didn't leave Chicago until late that night. Overall, this was an excellent value for the money. I've already recommended it to a friend who is travelling to Chicago soon.

Reviews.Title: “excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: hcalhoon
Reviews.Content: my wife and i took a weekend trip to chicago to do some sightseeing and visit friends. this hotel was within walking distance to many restaraunts, the Art Institute, Millinium Park, and the Miracle Mile. I was a little skeptical about driving and staying in the middle of Chicago with all the traffic/tourists but after talking to Mr. Kennedy at Comfort Suites he assured me it would be worth the effort and he was right. We look forward to coming back again next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: DLang69
Reviews.Content: Not only was my stay in downtown Chicago enjoyable but the staff at the hotel was professional as well as accommodating. One particular staff person by the name of Patrick Kennedy was extremely helpful in arranging my stay in the windy city. He not only went the extra mile in being able to book me a room at the last minute but also gave great suggestions of different venues to partake while visiting the 'Windy City'. All in all it was great customer care and I truly recommend anyone reading this review to check out this excellent hotel. The location is great and the rooms are spacious and also provide a great view of Michigan Ave and parts of the city. I truly enjoyed my stay at the Comfort Suites!!

Reviews.Title: “great weekend”
Reviews.Author: mariolka
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel last weekend It was our wedding universary we got room on 25 floor with MICHIGAN AVE VIEW Staff was very friendly breakfest was very good We would stay egain in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Staff that makes you feel like your home”
Reviews.Author: ssssscincinnati
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling to Chicago for three years and this hotel has been the most welcoming and responsive to my needs over this three year span. It is also a good value but the real reason I stay there is the staff. The rooms are spacious for a downtown location. They are also clean and attractively furnished even if they are a little "stiff". The cleaning staff is very efficent and have managed to find things that I left long after my check out! The complimentary breakfast does leave something to be desired but it is never a reason I would chose any hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveler9999
Reviews.Content: I travel all over the United States for business each week and was told that this was an excellent hotel to stay at since it was right across the street from where I am working. I arrived late and went to the room and was very disappointed. Business travelers are usually looking for quiet rooms with comfortable beds. When I got into the room I did notice that this room has a large kitchen and a big sitting area. Too bad that some of this room was not better allocated to the bedroom and especially the bathroom. The bedroom has a door that closes to block off light from the hall but the issue is the bedroom has no wall between it and the kitchen. If you are looking for any kind of privacy between the bedroom and kitchen/living room there is NONE! Since you feel like you are sleeping in the kitchen, all night long you will hear the fridge turn on and off. I eventually got up and unplugged the fridge so that I could sleep. The heating system is also extremely loud and the walls are thin so that if someone runs the water or flushes the toilet above your floor you will hear it. The bed (supposedly a king) was only 54 inches wide. I have a king and queen beds at home and this was nowhere as close. I searched the web and found that they are full size beds only! The bathroom is extremely small and cannot accommodate more than one person. When compared to the entire room size this is huge design flaw. The room that I was in had problems with water leaking when you flushed the toilet or ran the shower water would flood the bathroom. I would throw two towels down just to keep from slipping on the floor. The towels were dripping wet within seconds. If you decide to stay at this hotel, I would highly suggest checking the room first before committing to staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend trip to Chicago with friends”
Reviews.Author: catlover0525
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the Comfort Suites on Michigan Ave. we were placed in a room on the 23rd floor overlooking the Chicago River. It was absolutely gorgeous and the view was great, BUT there were 3 adults in my party and the room only had 1 double bed. So, I called the front desk to ask if we could have a different room with 2 beds, like I had booked originally. The man was very rude and said that they were overbooked and there was nothing he could do for me. I told him that wasn't good enough and that I refused to stay in that room with only 1 bed. He put me on hold and then magically came back on the line and said that there was a room down on the 6th floor, but it didn't have the same view but it did have 2 beds. I told him I'd take it because we'd rather have 2 beds than a great view. Now mind you, this was all happening after I (and my 2 friends) had worked an 8 hr. day, drove an hour to catch a train, rode 4 hours on the train and it was after 11 p.m. by this point. When I reserved the room on booking.com the room I reserved said it would accommodate up to 4 people...now how is 1 double bed that same room? It's not. The next morning we called down to the front desk to see if they could get tickets for us to the Skydeck, Planetarium, Field Museum, etc. and they told us no. It says right on the information booklet in your room that they will make bookings for you. Overall, the hotel is in a great location and is truly centrally located in the heart of downtown! The breakfast was great both mornings, hot waffles, eggs, bacon, sausage, bagels, cereal, and fruit! Our beds were extremely comfortable! The room was very clean and tidy! We had a great stay here, but I think the hotel staff could have definitely been more accommodating when we checked in and more helpful once we had stayed the first night! I will be going back and staying there again however, because for the location it's a great price and value that fits my budget!

Reviews.Title: “A Reasonably Priced Oasis With A Gorgeous View.”
Reviews.Author: anntmame
Reviews.Content: Scream it from the rooftops-the Comfort Suites in Chicago is the coolest thing since James Dean donned leather! It started when I called to reserve a room. The guy was pleasant and knowledgeable, immediately e-mailing me confirmation info. The king-sized hookup was the same price as the queen right then and I was skeptical, having been hoodwinked in the past. After a lengthy but fun journey, we somehow landed in downtown Chicago smack-dab in the middle of a nightmarish rush-hour clog. Hungry and road-weary, we inched along, cut off by supply trucks and cabs as the GPS malfunctioned, guiding us in a laborious circle to nowhere. It was time to cry uncle when the blasted thing directed us into an underground parking version of the street above that resembled an Escheresque urban labyrinth. We called Comfort Suites and VOILA!
