A sweetheart of a guy patiently guided us out of that ceement hell and into the waiting arms of their valet service, located at the nearby Hard Rock. Finally in the lobby, the friendly folks there took care of us, even whipping out a bunch of menus for local joints that deliver to the hotel. Flipping on the lights, I was agape. For literally fifteen dollars more than a crappy motel room on the outskirts of town, here was a gorgeous, clean little corner suite many floors up with a giant bed, flatscreens, sitting room with couch and desk, a separate kitchen with oven, microwave, large fridge, breakfast nook and cooking space, our own washer and dryer and more-right in the heart of downtown! The numerous windows and corner location boasted STUNNING views, and I immediately threw open the drapes to take in the city night, awestruck. We ordered up delicious food and settled in as our traffic-induced blood pressures plummeted. Later that night, yet again mesmerized by the view, I began to notice the flowing river begin to freeze over. By morning it was all white and crispy on top, amazing. Their "Savory Starts" breakfast was a Godsend. My eyes looked like Large Marge's as I took in the large spread including coffee, drinks, a waffle bar, bagels, pastries, eggs, sausage, cereal, fruit, and much more. A very friendly lady in charge of it all told me I could grab a tray from our room and load it up with delicious nibblies to bring back up for myself and my sleeping beau. If this all wasn't fab enough, the NOON checkout time is the icing on the Comfort cake!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, awesome, awesome”
Reviews.Author: bruzki
Reviews.Content: Location, staff, service, cleanliness...... i could go on and on... I have traveled to Chicago numerous times, this was my first stay at this Comfort Suites. The location was perfect. The staff was outstanding. Our King Suite was beyond expectations for the price we paid. We enjoyed 25th floor with ceiling to floor windows, very clean, very roomy, very quiet, very perfect...... i would book this hotel again and again.... The breakfast that was included was a super bonus. We had no right to expect any breakfast let alone what we actually received for the price that we paid. I have told everyone that I know about the value, service and experience that we had.... Thank you, thank you, thank you!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: tcrobbo
Reviews.Content: We arrived 3 days earlier than planned due to a storm cancelling our original flight out, but the staff were extremely helpful at changing our booking. They were short staffed due to the storm but we didn't notice a drop in service. I've been to several cities in the US and many hotels but have never had such friendly staff. The rooms are massive and extremely well appointed .The beds were really, really comfortable!! The staff couldn't be more friendly and helpful. Given the amount of snow that we had and all the salt on the ground, the washer/drier came in really useful too. The only possible downsides are that the bathrooms are a bit on the small side (but hey, how much room do you need in there?) and some of the finishes in the room are a little bit cheap. DON'T LET THAT PUT YOU OFF! The location is amazing - right between the loop and the mag mile. I would stay there again without question and will definitely recommend it to friends. Easily the best hotel I've ever stayed in in the US.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: bluepig112
Reviews.Content: FANTASTIC room. Could not ask for a better room. We travle to Chicago often, and this is the new place we will be staying! Our friends booked a room at the Hard Rock around the corner. We picked this place because we couldn't get in there. When they saw our room they were shocked. They wished they had stayed at Comfrot Suites! It is huge, view is fantastic, FREE internet, valet parking is $10 less than at Hard Rock, and it's the SAME VALET SERVICE, and free breakfast!. The breakfast was very good (as far as free breakfast goes). Hotel Staff was very nice and helpful. Room was very clean. Beds were comfy. We forgot toothpaste and they had some for us at the front desk. The "business center" was two computers in a hallway with a printer, but it worked for what we needed. We will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Travelers on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: uccellino7
Reviews.Content: I am a college student, and planned a trip to Chicago as a gift for a friend. This hotel was definitely worth the rate that I got. It was very spacious, with a full kitchen and living room in addition to the bed and bath. The location was excellent, very close to bus stops and El stations, and only a short walk from everything downtown Chicago has to offer. Although they don't officially offer early check-in, there was a room ready for us when we arrived at 11:30 (check in time is 3pm), but if you aren't that lucky, they will hold your luggage until a room is available. The amenities were not spectacular, but everything was very clean. Overall, it was a good experience, but I'll highlight a couple of the negatives, just to make you aware that they exist: My first impressions were not the best, because on the first afternoon, when we were trying to relax and get a nap before a late night at a theatre, there was some sort of commotion going on in the room across from ours. A housekeeping cart remained parked in front of the door (nearly blocking our way out) for about 2 hours. The workers went in and out of the room across from us, slamming the door at least once per minute (this went on for well over an hour), yelling loudly in spanish, and just being disrespectful. That evening when I asked the desk clerks about it, they were oblivious, saying there weren't any workers in there and making the two of us feel incredibly stupid. Thankfully, the problem did not persist the next day. The following morning, while my friend was downstairs getting breakfast (which was very good, by the way), housekeeping came knocking on the door at 8 am. Maybe that's normal for them, but having just gotten out of bed, I wasn't ready for them just yet. So I asked her to come back. She barely spoke English, so we agreed on "no service today", but it wasn't that big a deal. The only major problem was the bed. The pillow-top mattress was in grave need of replacement. It was very lumpy and uncomfortable, and so soft it felt as though I were sinking. For some that may be a good thing, but if you have back problems as I do, I caution you against this hotel. I found myself unable to go to sleep, tossing and turning for hours, and when I finally drifted off, I woke frequently, wishing for morning so I could get out of bed. If you seek relaxation and a good nights sleep, you should probably choose a different hotel. Now, what I've written may seem all negative, but don't be fooled. Comfort Suites on Michigan Ave is a great place, and if not for those few things, I would have given it 5 stars on everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and location”
Reviews.Author: QldAussie
Reviews.Content: We are an Australian family of 2 adults and 2 children aged 9 & 10. We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in December. It was in a great location on Michigan Ave. We were within walking distance to Millenium Park, Macy's, the magnificant mile, and had a small grocery outlet and Starbucks all close by. The staff were helpful in pointing out somewhere close by to eat as we were all starving after our arrival. We had a good view from our window and the rooms were very spacious. We had 3 TVs, 2 bathrooms, full kitchen, lounge area. They had a complimentary breakfast which was great, although the breakfast room was a little small to accommodate the amount of people they seem to have at one stage. I booked our room early in the year (for December) and got a great rate, which I noticed increased considerably later in the year. If you can, get in early and you will get a good rate. My only issue would be that trying to get a response via email was non-existent. This was disturbing when I was trying to contact the hotel via email. We were travelling around the USA and using hotel phones can be costly. Email was our main contact. Other than that, I would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: TomToledo
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on Tripadvisor, I picked this hotel for a long weekend family gathering. Based on everything we read, we were expecting to like the place, and we did. What I did not expect - but got- was a great view of the city. Our corner suite was on the back side of the hotel, but we still had a great view of the river and wacker drive through enormous windows. We rented three suites and all were spacious with well-equipped kithenettes, TVs in the living room and in the bedroom, plenty of closet space, comfortable beds, washer/dryer, and internet access. Furniture and decor were all modern and immaculate - no hint of cigarette smell anywhere in the hotel. There was enough room for all of us (4 adults, 2 kids) to gather comfortably in one of the living rooms and have dinner. The location is fantastic, within walking distance of many of the locations we wanted to visit. The front desk and housekeeping staff were friendly and efficient. The breakfast was OK, but I would prefer less use of disposable plates, cups, etc. The lobby is small and purely functional. There's no pool or restaurant here. What impressed us were the rooms, and that's what counted. We'll definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular! !!!”
Reviews.Author: c27run
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, room and view!!" Great staff, awesome ammenties! We will make this hotel our downtown stay destination evetytime we come into town! Love staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent alternative to the Hyatt during a conference”
Reviews.Author: TUKO666
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Chicago for 5 nights during a conference in November. The conference venue was at the Hyatt Regency, just a couple of blocks away from the Comfort Suites. The hotel was considerably cheaper, included internet and breakfast, pretty much everything the conference hotel didn't have. In addition, the location was superb next to the river on Michigan Ave, walking distance from shops, cafes, sightseeing locations, etc. The room was huge! almost a self contained apartment with a kitchen, fridge, oven, room to iron, etc. The corridor was a bit smelly (like a pipe burst or something), but the smell didn't go into the room. I will definitely stay here again if I'm back in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully helpful, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: pepitone
Reviews.Content: Our family includes 2 teenage boys. This was our first trip ever to Chicago. The room we had was spacious, clean and included 2 TV's, so the boys could choose what they wanted to watch in our down-time. The view was great, watching the lights at night never got boring. I cannot say enough about the staff....They were so friendly and helpful, from assisting us with bus routes, checking on times, to recommending a wonderful place to eat and how to get there. They held our bags after we checked out, as our train didn't leave til 4pm. There was something for everyone at breakfast, and the water pressure in the shower was great. The price, the location, the size of the room, the cleanliness, and most important, the helpfulness of the staff is a reason we will most assuredly stay here again on our next trip. Kudos to this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Will Definitely Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: Rebe79
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the location-right on Michigan Avenue 2 blocks from Millennium Station. We took the train into Chicago and stayed one night here. The front desk staff was the most friendly we have encountered in a long time. We had a King Suite on the 24th floor. The room was immaculate and extremely spacious. The hotel was filled with travelers but it was so quiet. The way our floor was laid out, you could not hear guests around you. The view of Chicago from our room was great. The breakfast area is a little small and cramped but there was a decent amount and the staff quickly refilled everything. Breakfast offerings: waffle, eggs, bacon, yogurt, bagels, muffins, danish, coffee, juice cereal, fruit, milk.. When we checked out the next day, we asked if we could leave our luggage and was enthusiastically told yes, no problem. We walked to Navy Pier, took a cab back ($7.00) and picked up our luggage. The woman at the desk was very friendly--something we didn't expect in downtown Chicago. We highly recommend staying at this hotel. the price is right and the location is convenient walking distance to everything in Chicago. I have added a few pictures of our room.

Reviews.Title: “A total gem just down the street from the magnificent mile”
Reviews.Author: clista0204
Reviews.Content: Everything from the staff to the room accomodations was outstanding. This was my first trip to Chicago and I am looking forward to seeing the city again. I will certainly book this hotel when I go back. The complimentary breakfast was very good and there was plenty to choose from. The front desk staff were very helpful with directions to local eateries. They really hook you up. Even when my trip home was delayed because of a snow storm (cancelled flight), it was no big deal to them and they were able to keep me in my same room for an extra night. Thanks so much for a delightful stay. I will for sure see you again when in the Windy City.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Location”
Reviews.Author: aardvark19
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located conveniently between the Loop and The Magniicent Mile making it easy to walk to shopping, restaurants, and many attractions. You get a fully equipped kitchen, a livingroom, and bedroom for very reasonable rates for downtown Chicago. The free breakfast is average. The service was great and the staff was helpful. Would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a convenient base to explore downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great set-up on Michigan Ave”
Reviews.Author: leisuretravel333
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here over the Thanksgiving Holiday. This a great place to stay and has everything we needed: a spacious & clean suite, ideal location to just about everything, a nice breakfast and a pleasant and helpful staff. We thought parking would be a problem but it wasn't. Elevators are tiny but they worked fine and never had any problems. Only thing we didn't enjoy were the powdered eggs on 1 of the days we stayed, but they had plenty to choose from. This is a great value and we'll be coming back! Thanks Comfort Suites staff!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, and well situated!”
Reviews.Author: ambr2007
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night on a business trip and had a lovely (if all too short) stay. I arrived on the Orange Line from Midway Airport and enjoyed my short walk to the front door. The gentleman at the front desk was friendly and good humored and offered me a room on one of the top floors, which I gladly accepted. I had a nice view and found the room very comfortable, quiet, and clean. I would love coming back here with my husband and daughter, as the kitchenette, storage space, and living area are well sized for a small family. The whole place is very clean and tidy. No frayed carpet, no banged up furniture, no mildew lurking under the caulking in the bathroom, etc. It makes for a more comfortable stay. The free breakfast was also good, nothing extravagant but definitely on the better end of the curve for hotels of this type. Oh... and did I mention the jacuzzi tub in my king suite? That was a nice bonus!! The next time I come to Chicago - and I will be back - I will stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and view”
Reviews.Author: freyagirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom, Queen suite. The view from the living room was of MIchigan Avenue and the river. It was just great to watch the boat traffic on the river and all the shoppers on the street. The kitchen had a full size refrigerator etc. with plenty of dishes. The furnishings are comfortable and new. This is a very nice hotel. It is walking distance from Millenium Park and the Art Institue and a short cab ride to the Field Museum. Lots of great restaurants within walking distance in a great neighborhood for walking after dark.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Australianchick
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel - all the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Our one bedroom suite was a great size, tastefully furnished and very clean. Location-wise it was excellent - close walking distance to most attractions and right at the start of the Magnificent Mile. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “No Internet!”
Reviews.Author: Resmama
Reviews.Content: This hotel has many advantages, but I would not stay here again unless they fix their Internet. The first day the Ethernet cable was broke (there is no wireless internet in the rooms), but the second day I got a new one - and the second day it worked OK (although I prefer wireless, especially in a hotel room!). The third day the internet was completely down, and only worked downstairs and not at all in the rooms. The fourth day it was incredibly slow, and the fifth day it went down every now and then. I think I lost about four, five hours of work just because the unreliable internet connection! In less than a week. That is not acceptable in a business hotel! Not in 2010. And not in USA and downtown Chicago. Although everything else was fine, I will not return until there is a wireless, functioning internet connection in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like Home”
Reviews.Author: effjayprojekts
Reviews.Content: The overall experience was fabulous. The room, the view of the city, the hospitality, the service was five stars. This was my first stay at a Comfort Suites and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel rocks!”
Reviews.Author: coupon21805
Reviews.Content: The staff is the best I have ever experienced. To make it even better was fresh baked cookies.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rates! Great Rooms! and Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: libbsho
Reviews.Content: The women in my family and I take an annual trip to Chicago every year. This is the first time we have stayed in the Comfort Suites and we will definetely go again. Our rooms were amazingly beautiful and we were right down the street from the best shopping areas. The Guest Services Manager, Matt Hafelein, was great. My Aunt met us later in the evening and Matt was nice enough to get her a cab and get her to where she needed to meet us. It was perfect. He definetely took a lot of the stress away for us. Would definetely recommend to those that are familiar and not familair with Chicago as everyone that worked there was helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: Journey1957
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for its location and because it had a microwave and refrigerator (I love to be able to have my own snacks and beverages) but I was amazed when I saw the room! It was huge and nicely decorated! It had a full kitchen including stove, dishes, pots, etc., 3 large closets, and even a washer and dryer! The staff was incredibly pleasant and helpful and the complimentary breakfast was great too, including a hot entree and make your own waffles.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: mcgarry1234
Reviews.Content: I love this place! It is ideally located and has great rooms with kitchens, complimentary hot breakfast and free internet. And the staff are all so helpful. We had the top floor, 2 bedrooms with king beds, 2 bathrooms, a kitchen, living room, dining room! It's like an apartment plus a balcony overlooking the beautiful Chicago River and the Tribune building. I would stay nowhere else when in Chicago. It's like a second home!

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: librarylady976
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just a few blocks from the subway (CTA). Our room had a fantastic view of the river & across Michigan Avenue which is a main thoroughfare with beautiful architecture. There are restaurants and shops within easy walking distance. I would recommend a room on one of the upper floors for a better view. There is wi fi on the ground floor & wired access in the rooms. Breakfast was good, but pretty crowded if you didn't get there early.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good size room, great value”
Reviews.Author: RmartinJr
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a nice hotel, on N. Michagan Ave, just steps away from the river, and 1.5 blocks from the park then this is it. My wife and I stayed in this hotel for a week long business trip that I had a few blocks down on Michigan, and we both loved our stay. We had a great view from the 24th floor. Our room was great. We had a separate bedroom, flat screen TVs, good size kitchen area, and nice desk area. I went down and got breakfast each morning, and brought it back up to the room which they suggested since the breakfast area is a little small.(I only noticed it cramped up on one morning out of 6 that we were there.) This hotel doesn't have a big lobby, but we didn't come to Chicago to sit in the lobby. This hotel doesn't have a large elevator area either, but we only expereinced one afternoon/evening(on Friday) when we had to wait for the elevator. The fitness area isn't all that big either. I will stay again at this hotel next time we are in town.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful surprises at every turn and great staff to go with them!”
Reviews.Author: SuefromCanada
Reviews.Content: Our suite was so clean, it shone - no surface contained dust or grime or fingerprints. The fully equipped kitchenette was spotless and the bathroom was the same. There was far more space in the two rooms than I had even hoped for, and the closet in the bedroom held a stacked washer and dryer. They even provided the detergent! The bed was great and the linens were a good quality. The complimentary breakfast was fresh and ample, and the wi-fi was free. Possibly the best of all was the staff, from the front desk through the breakfast lady, the maid, the doorman and even the maintenance man, all of whom cheerfully and willingly did everything they could to enhance our stay. The room rate compared very favorably with facilities offering far less and without the excellent location. Next time I'm in town, that's where I'll be!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and rooms, some negatives”
Reviews.Author: Rino
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week's stay at the Comfort Suites. The positives to this hotel are its location, room size (two room suites), a kitchen and washer/dryer in every room and the nice city views. The negatives are the slow elevator, size of lobby and breakfast room, and a really noisy fan or something outside our room. However, the biggest negative is lack of wireless in the guest rooms. My husband and I both brought our laptops (we run several small businesses) and we couldn't both be in the room and on the internet at the same time. There was one hard-wired connection, and everytime we moved the wire from one computer to another, we would have to go back to the start page and approve the terms and conditions. This was a pain. Plus the wire requires you to sit at the desk instead of being able to relax on the sofa with the laptop in your lap. There were several other minor inconveniences while we were there--the printer downstairs was inoperable for a few days and the internet did go down twice during our stay. Our key cards stopped working in the middle of our stay, which required a trip back downstairs--not a problem if the elevators weren't so slow. However, all considered, if they got wireless in the guest rooms, I would stay again, especially if I could get a better price than I was able to get for this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Some good things...some bad things”
Reviews.Author: gdub2
Reviews.Content: The good: Quiet rooms, washer and dryer in each room, plenty of room to hang clothes to dry in walk in closet, good price. The bad: Only one dinky, slow ice machine in the entire building. No ice bucket...had to get ice in a collander. No one available at curb to help unload luggage and carry it a half a block to the hotel. This spot is not marked, so we almost never found it. Plan to take breakfast back to your room as the eating area is quite small.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Nice staff”
Reviews.Author: JessicaB8
Reviews.Content: The Comfort Suites are in a very good location close to all the sites and shopping Chicago has to offer. The view of the city from the 18th floor was awesome. The rooms are VERY large, clean and spacious. I liked that there was a full kitchen and clothes washer and dryer in each of the rooms. Much larger than I expected in Downtown Chicago. The staff was helpful. I expected to have access to wireless internet while my stay at the hotel, however this was only available downstairs. Also, I felt a bit reprimanded by one staff member for not booking my shuttle back to the airport the night before. I just ended up calling my shuttle myself and there was no problems. Other than that my stay was wonderful. Oh, and the breakfast was great with lots of choices.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: rkatao
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Comfort Suites on Michigan Avenue. Great location for our visit to the Chicago attractions. We booked through one of the theater web sites and got a very good deal. Room was very spacious as a suite with a kitchen. Decor was attractive. Cooling the room was a challenge as a couple of days were pretty warm. Stacking washer and dryer in each room but the dryer vents directly into the bedroom. It can get a little hot and humid. The hotel is a little odd in that there are only 5 rooms per floor and 2 elevators for the entire 26 floors. When the housekeeping staff is trying to do their job, the lobby area of each floor can get a little crowded but they know what they are doing. Breakfast buffet is included and not bad. The only difference from day to day was alternating between bacon and sausage. The cheese omelets were pretty good but they were the same every day. The buffet was better than a lot of places I have been to recently. The hotel is blocks from the theater district, Millenium Park, the Chicago River and Magnificent Mile. We used a 3 day Chicago Trolley pass to get around with one stop 1/2 block away and another across the Michigan Ave. bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Could not ask for better! Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: rreiffer
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a reasonable place to bring two of our grandkids down to Chicago for the weekend and I had looked over many sites to try and find something reasonable. I finally chose the Comfort Suites. When we arrived we were greated at the door (very nice touch) and our requests for a room overlooking the mag mile had been accomodated. The rooms are great, spacious and very nice and clean. When you stay here (not if, when) you are in a great spot to walk all over Chicago and see the sights. We were able to walk to Willis Tower, Navy Pier and even walked back from Shedds. If you want to take a cab the most it should cost you is under $10. The breakfast that was provided was very nice both mornings although they are a little tight on space during the weekend. If you are epxecting a pool and many other "in hotel" luxuries this is not the place for you, but after all, how comes to downtown Chicago just to stay in the hotel? The staff was very friendly and courteous and overall we had a great experience. I will always look to stay here everytime I come down. Now wait, if I give this hotel a great review, it will just be booked solid every time I try to get in, so I guess forget everything I said. Jokes aside, this is a great place for the dollars spent and I hope they stick to their pricing, quality of service and everything that made this stay exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: vgcr
Reviews.Content: Chose the Comfort Suites for my Chicago Half Marathon stay. You really can't beat the location and the price (it was the official race hotel so we got a reduced rate). Walking distance to The Magnificent Mile, Millennium Park and even Navy Pier. Safe and quiet. The staff was helpful. Rooms were really large and clean. The full kitchen and washer/dryer would be a big plus if I ever returned with my two small children. There is no restaurant, but many are close by, and they do have a breakfast room (included in the price). Really appreciated the free use of computers in the lobby and the free toiletries daily - saves the hassle of traveling with liquids. My only complaint is that the bathroom was really small. There was virtually no counter space for toiletries and there is very little room in the bathtub/toilet area. They do have an enormous walk-in closet that I imagine most people don't use unless they are in for a very, very long stay, and it smelled a bit moldy (just the closet - not the room). That space would have been put to much better use if added to the bathroom (not sure that's possible, but...) I would definitely recommend this no-frills, practical and centrally-located hotel. Don't expect luxuries or a big lobby, but for the same price as many other hotels in the area you get a really large, comfortable room, with full kitchen, laundry machines, hi-speed internet, and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is ideal for the business or leisure traveler!”
Reviews.Author: NatalieCA228
Reviews.Content: Comfort Suites are ideally located in downtown Chicago. There are beautiful views of the Chicago River and Michigan avenue, As a business traveler I truely appreciate that there is a washer and dryer as well as full kitchen in each room. It is a perfect hotel for the business or leisure traveler and is the only hotel I stay at while in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Don't like cold showers.”
Reviews.Author: blhuber
Reviews.Content: Great location, good price, inadequate hot water. Took a cold shower 3 mornings in a row. Furthermore, tried to comment on Comfort Suite Website, wrote up review and then told couldn't do it at this time.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: Mac5Miami_FL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights at the Comfort Suites (Michigan Avenue-Loop) in a one bedroom suite facing Michigan Avenue. The suite was large, newly renovated, with a full kitchen, separate bedroom, and washer/dryer. The location was perfect. We walked from our hotel to John Hancock, Navy Pier, Sears Tower, the Art Institute... Valet parking at the Hard Rock one block away was no problem. The front desk was friendly and helpful but Natalie, the general manager, made our vacation extra special. We would return to the Comfort Suites in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Best, most affordable spot on Michigan Avenue!”
Reviews.Author: CaseyOConnell
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very comfortable, and has wonderful ceiling-to-floor windows so that you can sit in your living room (or even in bed!) sipping coffee and watching the world go by. I found the full kitchen to be a great value, and was amazed how all the necessities had been thought of, right down to a colander for making pasta. I found the staff to be exceptionally friendly, and they remembered my name and greeted me every time I came in or went out. The complimentary breakfast was tasty and had a number of good hot dishes to choose from. I will absolutely stay at this facility again, especially considering how much money my company was able to save versus lodging costs elsewhere on Michigan Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Suites - You Taught Me How to Rest Again!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelHoBoi
Reviews.Content: A big thank you to Rachel Earls, Sales Manager at Comfort Suites on 320 N Michigan Avenue for arranging the rooms for my family's stay in Chicago. I was in Chicago this past March when I personally met with Rachel. At that time, I personally checked out 5 different hotels to house my family vacation from August 18 - 22. Once Rachel showed me the rooms, I knew that I was home. The location is prime. It is in the middle of everything. Exit the hotel walking left (north on Michigan Avenue), and you are a one-minute walk from the Chicago River and close to great shopping and incredibly beautiful architecture, and a short walk to River North and the Gold Coast. Exit the hotel walking right (south on Michigan Avenue) and you are close to Millenium Park and Grant Park. Two must sees for visitors to Chicago and lots to do for the kiddies. The rooms are spacious. They have everything that a family could need. A safety deposit box, an ironing board, a washer and dryer, stove, microwave, two sinks, refrigerator, and probably one of the most comfortable beds that you will ever sleep in. Before I came to Chicago, I had trouble falling asleep; a condition that I had since January. Comfort Suites and its amazingly comfortable beds changed all that. If I could put that in pill form, it would sell like hotcakes. The free breakfast served daily was also great. It is somewhere between continental and hot, with the perfect balance. Typically, there was an omelette or egg medallion, and bacon or sausage. Biscuits, a waffle station, maple syrup, fruit yogurt (peach and strawberry), hot coffee, assorted danishes, various personal sized cereals, orange juice, milk (2% and skimmed), and more goodies. Maria - the person responsible for stocking the breakfast - worked very hard during my entire stay and I insisted on helping her. She was polite and explained that it was not necessary. Maria always had a smile. The staff at Comfort Suites were very friendly. The reception staff, and I apologize if I leave anybody out, were outstanding. Myrna was full of spunk and life - a real firecracker. Stephanie was very personable and always offered advice on where to go and what to do with a smile. Sara (my mother's personal favorite) was always cheerful and also referred us to some great foodie spots in downtown Chicago. The cleaning staff at Comfort were also particularly awesome. What struck me the most is how at a certain time in the morning, like clockwork, the cleaning staff would line up by the elevators waiting to ascend to their various floors in the hotel (there are 26 floors). The awesome part is how the staff would step aside and insist on letting the hotel guests get on board while they wait for the next available elevator. To me, this demonstrates how Comfort puts customers first. I highly recommend Comfort Suites to anyone looking to be in the heart of Chicago and close to everything. Chicago is a walkable city so bring your "comfort" shoes. I am telling all my friends about my experience. Once you walk into the larger than average rooms, you will feel like you have come home. Once your head hits the pillow as you rest from your long day of seeing the city, a sense of "comfort" will overtake your body and you will smile as you drift off to a peaceful night's sleep. You will wake up refreshed, ready for a hearty breakfast, and be ready to do it all over again. Comfort Suites - you have my heart. Thank you for reminding me what a restful sleep feels like. I will definitely be calling you when I return to Chicago in the future. Kudos to all the staff at Comfort. Especially, Rachel, Patrick (thank you for heading to Walgreens to find that "thing" for my disabled brother), Maria, Myrna, Sara, and Stephanie. See you all soon. Thank you so, so very much for teaching your staff how to treat people. Not to mention any names, but I have stayed at some of the top notch hotels and I found the staff to be fake. I did not get that feeling at Comfort Suites. Places to Eat: For deep dish pizza, you have to try Lou Malnati. The closest location to the hotel is 439 North Wells Street. Giordano's - another popular pizza place - is very close to the hotel, but it has stuffed pizza, not deep dish. People - they are not the same. Trust someone who has eaten lots of pizza in Chicago. For amazing, but a little pricey, Spanish tapas, check out Mercat a La Planxa located at 638 South Michigan Avenue. I got a buzz from taste buds sensory overload. One of the new chefs - his name escapes me - was recently featured on the food network. I highly recommend this place. But make sure you see the menu before you take a large group. It can be costly. For popcorn, you have to try Garrett Gourmet Popcorn located throughout the city. Try the Chicago Style mix - warning: your fingers will turn orange/yellow since this particular mix consists of cheese and caramel popcorn. Typically, it is a 50/50 split, but you can request a different ratio to your liking. Second City in Chicago - you will save money if you book your tickets to Second City over the telephone and pick them up at the box office. Ordering online will set you back $4.50 per ticket, as opposed to ordering over the phone which will cost you $3 per order...not per ticket. Huge savings to buy drinks with. John R. from Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: BCKTravelers
Reviews.Content: We recently traveled to Chicago to catch both a White Sox and Cubs game staying at the Comfort Suites on Michigan Avenue. First, it is in the perfect location walking distance from the Magnificent Mile to the north and the Art Institute to the south plus only a couple blocks from the Lake Subway station. The hotel is just a half block from the river. The hotel was great! Each room is like a small one-bedroom apartment with a small kitchen and a washer and dryer. As others have stated, the elevators can be very slow during the mornings and evenings. We took the opportunity to walk off some pizza by using the stairs. The staff was very friendly and helpful especially Sara and Gus. They gave us restaurant tips and told us to get a 3-day subway pass at the local Walgreen's store which is only a few doors away from the hotel. Don't be fooled when initially see the hotel--what it lacks in lobby space it makes up for in other ways. The hot breakfast in the morning was good and handy. When you do stay there, get a room from the 20th floor up and if you want a full view of the river (Wrigley and Tribune buildings) ask for the northeast side. We will definately stay there again, it was nice and a great deal..

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: 2peaches_10
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay @ the Comfort Suites on Michigan Ave. We had a great room facing Michigan Ave. The rooms are very oversized. We had 2 queen beds, a fully functional kitchen (stove/oven, dishwasher & refrigerator & microwave) with a breakfast bar, 3 large closets (one had to be 12 feet long). The free breakfast was very nice & as many people who visit Chicago know that not much is free in the city. The staff in the breakfast area were busy making sure everything was clean & just right. There is no big beautiful lobby @ this hotel but they do provide a very safe & clean facility. There is no pool but I have to admit we didn't need it. We were so exhausted seeing the city we were to tired to swim. The location of the hotel is excellent. It is next to the river. Within walking distance to all city attractions. The Navy pier free trolley stop is 2 blocks away. It was a 15 min walk to Navy pier (we like to walk) & 10 minutes to Macy's on State (old Marshall Fields).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Anuket83
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful stay the last weekend in June. Great location on Michigan Ave. The staff was overly helpful and kind - I sat in the lobby for 40 minutes waiting for my husband to return from a meeting elsewhere, and I was asked on numerous occasions if I needed anything and if I was comfortable, since the staff knew I was waiting. They went above and beyond what was expected! The room was spacious and very clean. We weren't disturbed by any noise - it was very quiet. We would definitely stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful staff -a bargain on Michigan Ave.”
Reviews.Author: roadtripdeb
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 6 dat stay at Comfort Suites. First of all, this hotel is in the perfect location. It is just minutes walk to Millennium Park, transportation, Mag. mile, shops, restaurants, etc. The room was a good size suite with a separate bedroom and living area with pullout couch and kitchen. The beds (even the pull-out) were comfortable with great bedding. The bathroom is a bit small, and it would be great if there was a make-up mirror or something provided for the desk so we could get ready while others are showering. But, overall the room was wonderful and even had great views of the river and all the action of the city. One of the best selling points for this hotel was the employees. In the 6 days we were there everyone we interacted with was so kind and helpful and just plain friendly! When we needed help with a broken toilet, it was fixed by the time we returned from dinner. When we needed a cork screw the staff literally went to 4 different grocery/convenience stores trying to find us one. We need another blanket - it was there in 3 minutes. Every time we needed assistance with anything someone was there to help and they went out of their way to make sure we had what we needed. The front door was held open for us each time we came and left with a huge smile and funny comment or greeting. We truly felt like we were coming "home" after a day and evening out exploring. So - the only thing they could do to improve is perhaps stock the kitchens a bit better. There was really nothing available if you really wanted to cook in the kitchens. Not even a corkscrew, as I mentioned! And we were quite disappointed there wasn't a real coffee maker, only a small one cup at a time thing. They do provide coffee downstairs, but it wasn't quite up to our Seattle standards, so we would have loved to make our own pot. There were only a few glasses, dishes. Pretty sparse - which was okay for us as we really wanted to dine out for this trip. I highly recommend this hotel for families! It's probably not the most romantic or fancy - but for our trip with mom and 3 adult sisters it was just perfect - and a great bargain at about $150 a night.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT for the business traveller”
Reviews.Author: WeatherWife
Reviews.Content: Our company had the good fortune to choose Comfort Suites for a first time business trip to Chicago in late July. We booked a suite in April and by early July found we also needed 2 small conference rooms. Although the hotel was completely booked, including conference rooms, Rachel, the sales manager, arranged to swap our suite for a larger suite with a sitting area to use as one meeting room and converted the Atrium Room, used for breakfast, into a lovely second meeting room. The staff was pleasant and ready to help with anything our company needed during our three day stay, and the 24 hour main desk was a godsend, as the graveyard shift gladly helped with faxes and copying that our company needed at 3AM, for a 7AM presentation. Free breakfast, comfortable beds, located in the center of all the action, washer and dryer in the room, full kitchen facilities, walking distance to many restaurants, competitive rates - Comfort Suites Chicago has it all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Great Location, Great Value!!”
Reviews.Author: Marlene_kernahan
Reviews.Content: We chose the Comfort Suites, based on the wonderful reviews on TripAdvisor. What surprised us was the value of what we got. We had a wonderful suite that was more like a one bedroom apartment, complete with a full kitchen and a washer/dryer in the bedroom. The parking was not a huge issue for us, like some previous posters mentioned. We received an email from the hotel prior to our arrival, explaining in detail the parking. I used Googlemaps and Streetview to better conceptualize the area. Once we got there, we knew exactly where we were going. The charge is $30/night for parking which seems like the norm for a large city. A few things mentioned by previous posters I'll also mention. The water pressure is very poor, but it wasn't a deterrent for us at all. Someone also mentioned the traffic noise but I can honestly say that we rarely heard anything out of the ordinary. Yes, we did hear sirens but you're in a large city in the downtown core so we expected this. With regard to the breakfast bar, you really do need to be downstairs by 8:00 if you want to get a seat in the breakfast room. That was hard for us to do, so we would usually grab a few items and take it back to the room. The location is fantastic; it's in walking distance to Millenium Park, Navy Pier, the Magnificent Mile, Grant Park and the river. We also went to see a White Sox game and found the front desk very helpful with information regarding the El. (The public transit system is fantastic in Chicago - don't be afraid to use it!). The rooms are large and comfortable. I loved the bed, great mattress and wonderful linens. I also loved the fact that the living room was separate from the bedroom and each contained a flat screen tv.It turned out the washer/dryer was a godsend - the weather was so hot and sticky, we would often need to change our clothes before dinner. The front desk staff were reasonably friendly, usually greeting us on our way in or out. The doormen were excellent, always ready with a friendly word and a smile. Our experience with this hotel and with Chicago was so overwhelmingly positive that we are making plans for our next trip. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location-Great hotel-Confusing Parking”
Reviews.Author: MeganNWL
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great value! After spontaneously deciding to go to Chicago, we found a discounted room rate for that same night on the Choice Hotels website. After driving around for 20 minutes trying to find the hotel (the "sign" is a small red awning with "Comfort Suites" written on it) it took another 10 minutes to try to figure out where the valet was. On the confirmation from the hotel, it says to go about 200 feet, turn right, and it is between Walgreens and the Hard Rock Hotel. The valet is actually at the entrance to the Hard Rock Hotel. Needless to say, we were very frustrated. Checking in helped relieve our frustrations. The woman who helped us was very nice and explained where anything and everything we may need could be found. The room was much more than we expected! It was like a small apartment with amazing views. The only problem we found with the room was if we were in the bathroom or kitchen, we could clearly hear talking from other people on our floor. Every time we entered the hotel lobby, there was someone there to open the door for us, and the people behind the desk always said hello. The location of this hotel is perfect! It is within walking distance to Millenium Park, the museum campus, Navy Pier, and the Magnificent Mile.

Reviews.Title: “Great all-around experience for a large wedding group”
Reviews.Author: Caleb_Caleb
Reviews.Content: Comfort Suites hosted us and 120 of our family and friends, and everyone I spoke to came away with a good feeling. From the desk people to the bell staff, everyone was responsive and friendly and made us feel welcome. Patrick and Rachel, who run the group sales office, handled our questions and requests for months beforehand and followed up proactively, and professionally, when we were unable to. The property itself is rather small and the lobby cozy. The rooms, by contrast, are huge. They were totally renovated in summer '09 as part of the new Comfort Suites branding, and while they aren't plush or deluxe, they are tastefully decorated, clean, and have new amenities, including stoves, fridges, and washer/dryers. The rooms appear to be wearing well, and housekeeping kept ours in good order. The location is superb, halfway between Millennium Park and the Magnificent Mile. I'm sure there are quieter places to stay, but you definitely get the buzz of being in the middle of it all. My wife and I got the impression that many aren't yet aware that Comfort Suites is even there. Our photographer, who hadn't worked events there previously, raved about the views from the executive-suite bedrooms (banks of windows on two sides of the corner bedroom) and balconies during the getting-ready shots. Pros: ~ Nice location--more centrally located than the pricier properties up the Magnificent Mile. Two blocks to Millennium Park, half a block to the Riverwalk. From our top-level rooms, this made for a fantastic view up and down Michigan Avenue, w/ the Wrigley and Tribune buildings just to the north. ~ Really comfortable beds--not what you might expect in budget accommodations. Only the beds at a few four-star hotels or resorts I've stayed at topped them. ~ Large rooms--a common problem in our queen studios was hearing people knocking at the doors because, in the rooms, we were so far away. Seriously. ~ Service--solid, attentive, friendly service that made it feel like a boutique hotel. ~ Breakfast/atrium--decent and free hot breakfast in a sunny, modern atrium. Cons: ~ Parking. With no garage adjacent to the hotel and no stopping on Michigan Ave., guests must unload half a block south and then loop around to park at 111 Wacker. This proved too confusing for some of our guests unfamiliar w/ downtown Chicago. ~ Small bathrooms. Perhaps the most "economy" aspect of the property. ~ Elevators. While we didn't find this to be as big a problem as some who have posted, there are two elevators and 26 floors, and at busy times this could mean a few minutes' wait to get downstairs (or up). ~ No restaurant or bar: If you like a place where you can pad downstairs in your slippers to grab a drink, this isn't your place.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: ParisOnze
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in a great location. The general comfort, the view, the kindness of the staff, the elegance of the furniture, the Michigan Ave location (downtown Chicago) make this a perfect place to stay at. It's hard to fault Comfort Suites. If one really must, then one could say that breakfast was just OK (limited range of products). Customers should be advised to come down for breakfast before 8.30 to avoid lift congestion.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with Everything You Could Need”
Reviews.Author: ChocAHolic10
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed here in July and were very pleased with this property. The location was right in the thick of Michigan Avenue. So it was busy, but close to everything. We were easily able to walk to Millenium Park, the closest metro stop on State Street, and a bus stop just around the corner. Walking to the Magnificent Mile is manageable, but with kids it may not be worth the aggravation. Driving a car is frantic, but once we arrived, we parked the car and never used it again until we left. On that note, you need to drive around to the Hard Rock Hotel entrance on Lake Street to valet your car. Then you can forget about it for the duration of your stay. The Comfort Suites staff will help you carry everything to the hotel, which is a one minute walk up Michigan Avenue. A few doors down from the hotel is a Walgreens drugstore. If you are in need of any minor grocery items (they even had fresh fruit) or virtually anything else, you can find it here. Breakfast was great. The breakfast attendant was extremely helpful. On our last morning, we didn't pay attention to the hours of the buffet and narrowly missed it. However, the attendant rounded up more than enough food from the kitchen to feed our party of 8. That type of service when you have hungry kids is priceless. The rooms were great. Complete kitchens and a washer and dryer are included. We had a king bed suite, with a pull-out sofa. I had my reservations about the pull-out, but the mattress appeared to be almost new. The views are amazing. The only negative comment I have is regarding the size of the bathroom, as it is extremely small. However, the sink has a full cabinet so we used it to store items we might normally have left on the counter. It certainly would not deter me from staying here in the future. The staff were very friendly and helpful, particularly the doormen/porters. They offered some of the best service I have ever encountered in a chain hotel. I would not hesitate to stay here again as the value for money was outstanding and the service exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “I love it!”
Reviews.Author: MichiganRules
Reviews.Content: February was my 2nd trip there, with my adult daughter. It's by far my favorite place to stay in my favorite city! Great location. FULL KITCHEN! Comforable beds. Good breakfast! PERFECTION!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: SheenaBeana
Reviews.Content: We stayed her over the Forth of July weekend with out seven year old. We loved his hotel. The location was wonderful right in the heart of Michigan Ave. We stayed in room 2001 which is a double queen efficieny. The efficiency was more than enough room for our family to be comfortable. The doormen were very friendly and always had a smile on their faces. The breakfast was very good. There were waffles, eggs, meat, fruit, pastries, and juices. The only problem we had was when checking out we asked how long we could leave out vehicle in valet without an additional charge. We were given the incorrect infomation by the front desk and when we returned were told we owed an extra $21 for valet. The front desk clerk called the manager when we explained what we were told and thankfully the problem was resolved.

Reviews.Title: “I would completely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Walkthedream
Reviews.Content: This Comfort Suites generously donated rooms for my group to stay in while we were in Chicago. That alone was fantastic, but on top of that this inn is quite possibly one of the best extended stay inns I have ever had the opportunity to visit. I have no complaints! The service was friendly and timely, the rooms clean and spacious. Also, the inn was conveniently located right on Michigan Ave directly downtown. I can not speak more highly of our stay! Thank you so much Comfort Suites for making our stay a completely positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: mmdkbjtj
Reviews.Content: Great location! Great service! Friendly! This is the first time I have ever put a review online but I/we were so thrilled with this hotel that we wanted to share the good news. We traveled in a group of 4 women (sisters). We were expecting a suite with a bedroom and living room. To our amazement we had been upgraded to the penthouse suite on the 26th floor! It had 2 bedrooms with king sized beds - 2 bathrooms - full kitchen and living room. Also a small outside deck overlooking Michigan Ave. The view was spectacular! We have made several trips to Chicago but this was by far our best hotel experience. We traveled from MIchigan City, Ind on the commuter train and the hotel is just a short walk from that train terminal. It's right in the heart of the shopping and theater district. We found great restaurants close by and walked to Millinium Park (another short distance away) for some Taste of Chicago treats. We found we spent more time in our room playing cards and relaxing than we have done before just because we LOVED OUR ROOM! The staff was great and the breakfast was more than adequate. The water pressure mentioned by some other reviewers before is low but it so paled in comparison to the positives that I hardly want to mention it as a negative. I can't imagine us going back to Chicago to any other hotel. We found the diamond in the rough!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Bretharte
Reviews.Content: We found the location of this hotel perfect for our visit as tourists to Chicago. It was a short walk from a Blue Line Metro stop direct to/from O'Hare Airport. We walked to all of the tourist sites that we had time to visit during our three day stay ( Navy Pier, Millenium Park, the Loop, Art Institute, Sears Tower). The popular Chicago River architectural boat tour was directly across the street. Our room was large and had a separate bedroom. It included a washer/dryer which was most useful when we managed to get caught in a midwest summer downpour. The complementary breakfast buffet was plentiful and tasty. At well under 200 dollars a night, it was a very good value and we wouldn't hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Shower water pressure too low”
Reviews.Author: PSG99
Reviews.Content: Nothing worse than having a long day and coming back to your room and trying to take a shower with very low water pressure. Not even enough to wash the shampoo out of your hair. I complained to the front desk, but I am guessing this is inherent to this hotel and not going to be fixed. I wouldn't stay here again for this reason alone. Everything else was okay.

Reviews.Title: “Bigger rooms than my apartment”
Reviews.Author: MrFoster
Reviews.Content: Good News: These are some great rooms, more like small efficiency apartments, Kitchen has stove, oven, fridge, microwave, and all the utensils to cook a small meal. The living room has couch, chairs and coffe table. Walls of windows on to sides to a great view of the city. Staff is very friendly and curteous. Bad News: Even on the 21st floor, street sounds are loud - especially police and ambulance sirens. For such a large room, the bathroom is very cramped. The toilet uses a small round bowls rather than an oblong bowl like most hotels. The shower has a ridiculously low flow rate, AND the hot water is only luke-warm by 8:00 AM. The morning breakfast is rubbery eggs or make-yourself waffles. There is only one ice machine on the lobby level for this 25 story hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal around Michigan Avenue”
Reviews.Author: 1q2w3e4r003
Reviews.Content: Based on traveling to Chicago on business for the last 10 years, this is the best deal in the Michigan Ave area. The rooms are spacious, clean, quiet, and the staff is very accomodating. Simply put, this is the best deal around. Everything is in walking distance if you perfer, and convenience to the train and cabs is also easy. The breakfast & fitness room make mornings a snap, and the convenience of nearby restaurants make dinner/lunch very easy. The true suite rooms (there is a door that closes & truly separates the bedroom from the living area) make traveling with others/children very easy. The kitchen is stocked with utensils and dinnerware. This has become our preferred location & doubtless will remain so.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: jaxman3
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room with 2 queen beds for 4 people. At check-in we were told they had upgraded us to a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom suite. Definite bonus!! This is not a luxury hotel, but the room was nice and had everything we could possibly need (including a washer/dryer). The room was very clean. The staff was really nice and always smiling. The breakfast was good, cheese omlets, bacon, waffles, fruit, cereal, coffee, juice. The absolute best thing about this hotel is the location. We were 1/2 block from the River Walk and a few blocks from Millenium Park, Art Institute, the Russian Tea House, Lake Michigan. You don't need a car because everything you need is withing walking distance. The room overlooked Michigan Ave, which was a little noisy, but we had nice views of the beautiful buildings surrounding the hotel. I can't wait to go back & will definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “the staff is so friendly / spacious rooms / quick service”
Reviews.Author: noelkh12
Reviews.Content: I definitely recommend this hotel. Since October of 2009, I have stayed in this hotel for over 4 months. My stay was pleasant, comfortable, the service is quick, spacious rooms. I commend the management of this hotel. I will be coming back to this hotel over and over again for all my trips to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice”
Reviews.Author: Jamiecakes1975
Reviews.Content: I have been all over the Chicago area on business and have been staying in many different hotels over the past couple months. I typically stay at Choice properties however. I have been staying mostly in suburban hotels to avoid the higher rates that the Chicago hotels charge. I decided to try out a downtown property using my Choice privillage points and decided to try this new Comfort Suites. I was blown away, not only is the location awesome, close to all the vibrance of summer time in Chicago, but the rooms are great. My suite was so clean and well appointed that I must say this is the best Comfort Suites I have ever stayed in. Using my points was great because I am sure this hotel demands a higher rate. The breakfast was up to par and the Internet was flawless. This is one hotel that ibwould return to anytime I am in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: CarolJ64
Reviews.Content: The Comfort Suites in Chicago is a perfect location along the Magnificint Mile. It is close to shops and great restaurants. The room itself was great with a wonderful view of the river and some of the beautiful architecture that Chicago is so famous for. One of my colleagues mentioned that she had a washer and dryer in her room. I actually thought she was joking until I opened up one of the doors in my bedroom and saw for myself that there truly was a washer and dryer. How convenient for travellers! The staff was extremely helpful and I was especially impressed with the doormen. They always had a smile to greet you with and it was obvious they valued exceptional customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Good Value”
Reviews.Author: eagle25
Reviews.Content: We took the Amtrak train into Chicago for a get-a-way weekend. We are not real familiar with the Chicago downtown area so we were relieved to find that we were close to both the CTA trains and buses, making it easy to get around town to the places we wanted to visit. We were also surprised at the delightful suite we stayed in at this hotel. It had a beautiful view of the city, a full kitchen,bath, sitting area with a flat screen TV, and a separate bedroom that also had a large flat screen TV and a very comfortable queen-size bed. The staff was very friendly but they were not especially informative with how to get around Chicago. They googled everything on the computer and we found that we were able to get around better on our own by walking and being adventurous. The complimentary breakfast did not have the best variety we had ever had, but it was tasty and sufficient to start our morning. Our overall experience was a good one and we would definitely stay again next time we are in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for looking after us, in spite of our error!”
Reviews.Author: MV58
Reviews.Content: We wish to express our appreciation to Sarah in the office on Friday, May 21, when we came to the Comfort Suites in downtown Chicago. We had accidentally booked for the wrong night, and Sarah, with the manager who was at home, made every effort to accommodate us in spite of our error, and in spite of your hotel being fully booked on the next night. We had a beautiful room, your breakfasts were amazing and we were so grateful that our mistake didnâ€™t leave us â€˜homelessâ€™ for the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: AGvanderWesthuizen
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in a lovely large one bedroom apartment. Was beautiful and clean - serviced daily. Well located. All staff was very friendly. Great breakfast. Close to perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: cweideman
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. From the friendly front desk staff and doormen (who took my luggage up to my room!!) to the amazing view and gigantic hotel room I couldn't ask for anything better. My hotel room was triple the size of a regular room and for the same rate! I had a seperate bedroom, living room with a great flat screen TV and one in my bedroom too! The hotel was quite, so well kept. I really don' think you could get a better deal or nicer/bigger room in the city in a better location! I LOVED THIS COMFORT SUITES!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel & Service”
Reviews.Author: FoxOne123
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Chicago for the first time on Business and my assistant came across this hotel initially on it's location for my meetings. I was originally booked in for a week, but due to the Volcanic Ash clouds in Europe I had to extend my stay for another 4 days, which the staff were helpful to arrange, especially Patrick. This delay allowed me to mix my business trip up with some site seeing and the location was excellent for this too, smack bang in the city centre and all the main attractions nearby. Throughout my stay all the staff were helpful and courteous including the excellent suggestions offered for local cuisine and tours - honest staff opinions. Furthermore, due to the hotel actually being more like an apartment, with clothes washing facilities (in-room), kitchen, separate lounge & bathroom etc.. It made my stay even more pleasant, making me feel more at home than in a hotel. Rooms are fairly quite (except for when the odd hotel neighbours leave their rooms and slam the door shut, and the occasional ambulance sirens) and very well equipped. The buffet breakfast is pretty standard (no frills), but the breakfast room is small. As I was a solo traveller, I managed to find a place most days either on my own or sharing with someone else's table. The only really frustrating moment I had was when I lost internet connection for a day (the day I decided to work from the hotel) and the problem could not be resolved by the internal hotel staff. I was referred promptly to the external provider, but it took them almost 24hrs to resolve - in the end, I ended up working from the breakfast room as the WiFi there was my only option. At all other times the internet in my room was ok. Overall, an excellent hotel. I am scheduled to return to Chicago in September on another business trip and will definitely be returning to this hotel. Great value, location and amenities for both business and leisure travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Comfort Suites-Great location, BIG ROOM”
Reviews.Author: rjkcpktrips
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Comfort Suites April 30-May 2nd. We got a great rate (approximately 170.00 per night). We were heading to the Cubs game on the 30th, and the front desk was kind enough to stow our bags in a locked room and everything was fine when we picked them up for check-in. The hotel is fairly close to an "L" line as we flew in from O'hare. The hotel is also close to the red line (Wrigley Field or US Cellular Field). Location, this hotel for its price is unparalled. The room was quite large. We had a full kitchen, walk in closet, and desk area. I was under the impression each room had wi-fi, which it does not. Hotel does provide ethernet cords. Room also had flat screen tvs. We were given free hot breakfast each day ( Saturday: Eggs, and bacon. Sunday: omlete and sausauge links. Waffles are there each day). We didnt use the exercise equipment. The only drawback was the bathroom. I thought it was small, our toilet didnt flush occasionally, and my friend called for extra towels Friday evening and someone told him that they were out. I asked Saturday morning (at 8am) and had towels delievered within 10 minutes, so I am unsure about the difference 10 hours made in the towel situation. Overall, I would definately stay here again. This is a great hotel for the value. The beds were great (pillows were not). Everyone was very friendly and the location to the Magnificent Mile is great for the price. You also have a 7-11 and CVS Pharmacy very close by for any incidental needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great in every way”
Reviews.Author: klemche
Reviews.Content: Nicest staff, big clean comfortable suite. Terrific location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: pnksurvivr
Reviews.Content: Beds were super comfortable. You couldn't beat the location if you want access to the Magnificant Mile. Staff was friendly and there were no hidden fees, which you sometimes get when hotels are priced in the lower range. Now , this wasn't uppity fancy but it certainly was everything I wanted in a hotel. Note: Comfort Suites shares valet parking with Hard Rock Hotel just around the corner, so you need to pull up there. The Valet's were really great too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, great stay”
Reviews.Author: JohnD211
Reviews.Content: I found this recently renovated hotel to be a wonderful find in the city of Chicago. Its location on Michigan Avenue can not be beat and the prices are more than reasonable when compared to other hotels in the area. The staff are very helpful and friendly and the rooms are much larger than most hotels in Chicago. If your looking for a great value for your money and a very comfortable stay this is the right hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: BuffyT
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for visiting the city. Room we had was fantastic with great view of city on our side of building. Everything close by that you need. Good transport links as well

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, with spacious comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: PRC0809
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bed queen suite with a view of Michigan Ave. The room was large and comfortable with every possible Amenity. There were 4 adults in the room and we never felt like we were on top of each other. Internet and breakfast were great perks, location is close to bus stops and within walking distance to most things (we took the bus to science and industry museum). Hotel staff were able to answer all questions we had about where places/bus stops were located, they were able to accommodate us by getting us extra chairs for the eating area of our room as well as an extra blanket when it was needed. Parking was a bit confusing, we parked at the public garage beside the hardrock hotel and had no problems with that particular garage. The only thing that is a bit lacking in the hotel is the bathroom, it is very small and we never had enough towels (max 3 towels for 4 people even after we requested more). But even with those two minor issues we would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to family and friends and will probably return ourselves!

Reviews.Title: “All the comforts of home”
Reviews.Author: beothuk7
Reviews.Content: About a 10-15 walk from the Blue Line and near bus stops. The Magnificent Mile is a few blocks away. Suites are large and come with fully equipped kitchens. Good comp breakfast. Free Ethernet (beats WiFi in my book). Can't really think of anything negative to say (must not be trying hard enough).

Reviews.Title: “Best stay ever at a Choice Hotels property!!”
Reviews.Author: MajorNurse
Reviews.Content: Loved my stay at this hotel. Felt like I was staying in my own condo! It was very comfortable. The daily hot breakfast was great,. The ideal location was in walking distance of most of downtown Chicago's best sites. Will definently stay again! Hope you enjoy your stay as much as I did.

Reviews.Title: “Room for your family to spread out and relax!”
Reviews.Author: f45001151
Reviews.Content: The Comfort Suites on N. Michigan Ave. offers a suite that will meet your families needs, even my teenagers loved it. It felt like an apartment with all the amenities-full kitchen, eating area, separated bedroom, plus a washer and dryer in the room-amazing! I cannot say enough good things-location, service, rooms, value- all excellent! I will definitely stay here when we visit Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Visit to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: GrammyBecky
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about the room my Mom and sisters stayed in April 10-13, 2010. On one hand, I found the room to be spacious but a bit awkward with the bathroom layout. It was clean and definitely more roomy than other hotels I have stayed at in Chicago. This room would be a good layout for a family because the room had a compact kitchen and washer/dryer. The parking is a NIGHTMARE! We went to the parking lot by the Hard Rock Cafe and were told it wasn't the parking for the Comfort Suites. We wanted valet but were turned away. The self park, $30 night, is across the street from the hotel meaning you have to drag your luggage through the streets of Chicago. We found out that we were given incorrect information at the Hard Rock Cafe area parking lot. This isn't the hotel's fault but it needs to be addressed. I would only recommend this hotel if you don't drive. The other puzzling element is the lack of enthusiastic hotel front desk staff. They were professional but blah. Never said hello as you passed, basically ignored you unless you asked a question. Overall, this is a good hotel for a family especially since it does serve a breakfast. However, it needs some customer training. If you're in town soon, don't miss Billy Elliot at the Oriental Theatre. Fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Value, Stupendous Location”
Reviews.Author: acdhuber
Reviews.Content: Wow, wow, wow. I stayed at the Comfort Suites the night before I had an early flight for a business trip. The quality of my experience for the value was absolutely amazing. My room was huge with a wonderful view up North Michigan Avenue, including the Tribune Tower and the Chicago River. The room was comfortable, clean, and more than met all of my requirements. I typically stay at higher-end hotels, so I can be a very picky customer. This hotel far exceeded my expectations. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, and I cannot wait to recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! One of the undiscovered hotels of MI Ave!”
Reviews.Author: dubtown29
Reviews.Content: Traveling from out of town and driving the first time in Chicago, I was completely lost. It took a good hour to park and get into the hotel. This was mainly because the hotel is in such a great location (right on Michigan Avenue) that it took so long. Parking is hectic but the garage they recommend is across the street and is the best bet. Parking in Chicago is terrible, and parking the hotel was not any different, BUT that is way out of their control. The guest services rep was friendly and we were checked in within a matter of minutes. Our room was on the 13th floor as the hotel has only has six suites per floor, but the elevators were extremely fast and the room was amazing. Upon walking in we were in shock! (Good shock). The window faces MI avenue and the view was spectacular... of course the window needed cleaned ;) but it was winter. The beds were incredible! We did not use the kitchen much but it is nice to have. It has everything, dishes and a dishwasher, stove, microwave, fridge, and a toaster. The shower was kind of cramped because it was like in a closet but then again, MICHIGAN AVENUE, limited space. The only complaint that I personally had was the hallway smelling of sewage. I talked with the front desk and they took care of the problem. Overall we were extremely satisfied with the service of the hotel and the continental breakfast was beyond great, all for free! If you are looking for a nice, decently priced hotel close to everything Chicago has to offer, STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, Comfortable, A Bit Outdated”
Reviews.Author: JDevin
Reviews.Content: The parking issue was a bit confusing. Guests who don't want to self-park in a nearby garage use the valet service of the Hard Rock Hotel around the corner. It's $45/day. They call the bell person from Comfort Suites to come help with luggage. It may take awhile -- in my case ten minutes. Once in the hotel, I was greeted by friendly staff, which is always important to me. The elevators were a bit old and clunky, but once inside my room, I was pleasantly surprised. I stayed in a spacious suite with a kitchen and living room, and everything was very clean and comfortable. A big bonus here is that there is a washer/dryer in each suite, and there is no additional charge. The bathroom is small, especially given the size of the rest of the room, but the rest of the accommodations made up for that. I loved the large desk, the wonderful city view, and the firm bed. I did not have one of the rooms with a balcony, and I wish I had. A minor complaint here is that when entering/exiting the hotel, one has to pass the smoking guests gathered outside. I wish Comfort Suites had another designated smoking area away from their entrance. For the price, I think Comfort Suites was an excellent choice for a downtown stay. It's close to many attractions and restaurants, and there's a great coffee shop across the street. The rooms are a bit outdated, but the cleaning staff does a superb job and the staff is quick to respond to guests. For instance, my room was missing a bath stopper. A maintenance man arrived within ten minutes to replace. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent downtown home away from home”
Reviews.Author: purpletootsies
Reviews.Content: Booked to attend a conference a short walk away. The room value was superb. Room was a small apartment - laundry, kitchen, living room, bedroom. Breakfast was included and was wonderful - hot and cold items. Free hot coffee was available 24/7. Front desk was always friendly and helpful. Our room had a river view. Would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Best Downtown Deal in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: DGW005
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my two friends from Canada. Plenty of room...excellent views down Michigan Ave, walking distance to shopping. Breakfast was included ...don't see that in Downtown Chicago too often. The staff was very nice and helpful with recommendations for dining. The rooms are clean and very very spacious. I would stay here again. Great place for long term stays as the rooms have kitchens , tons of closet space and washers and dryers....

Reviews.Title: “Cannot beat value for price”
Reviews.Author: beavie1613
Reviews.Content: I have never, ever been more pleased with my accommodations that at the Chicago Comfort Suites. In room kitchenette, very clean; friendly staff; very conviently located for my convention and other attractions. First class hotel at moderate price.

Reviews.Title: “Overwhelmingly hospitable”
Reviews.Author: barnzopt
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I stayed here for 45 days. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The housekeeping staff always made sure that the rooms were always cleaned. The location is fantastic with great benefits as far as discounts at local restaurants etc. If you plan an extended stay I would definitely recommend the Comfort Suites or even for just a few nights. Excellent deal. The only downside was the breakfast could have been a little better. But hey, it was free.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the money”
Reviews.Author: kjones38
Reviews.Content: The Comfort Suites was a great value. The suite was very clean and very nice. Great location to downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely happy...”
Reviews.Author: mylife274
Reviews.Content: At check-in I asked will the room be by an elevator. The guest representive informed me of that possibilty.
